23001.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Chemistry
23001.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

CHEMISTRY: Since the dawn of time, humans have wielded influence over their surroundings. Ages of struggle and research into nature's elements have brought a deep wisdom. We have since learned that we cannot use lye to convert lead to gold. So we want you to do it.

23002.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Astronomy
23002.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

ASTRONOMY: Getting tired of your everyday mind-control devices and rampaging mutants? Does the thought of making yet another mundane machine lack luster? Ever think that blowing up planets might be fun? Why not develop a Space Wars program? Fully government funded, Mad Scientist University is the premier place to launch those dreams!

23003.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Computers
23003.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

COMPUTERS: You will be integrated into the Mad Scientist University Computer Program. Compliance is mandatory. Primary objective: Translate everything into binary. Get your mice working

23004.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Dorm Life
23004.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

DORM LIFE: Overpriced living. Cramped quarters. Unsanitary conditions. Strange roommates. All this can be yours, at Mad Scientist University's on-campus living! We have: Communal showers, to bring the community together. A meal plan, because we know mad scientists forget to eat. Plenty of spare vermin, in case you need cheap experiment subjects or just forgot to feed your snake. Sign up for your cell today!

23005.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Greek Life
23005.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

GREEK LIFE: We here at Mad Scientist University have a long and honorable tradition of study, service, and something else. The Greek Life at Mad Scientist University strives to be that something else... with togas, funnels, and donkeys, we want to fill that space in your life. We want to create a new race, not just as an extra credit project for your Anthropology project, but as a way of life. Do you think you can handle it?

23006.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Physical Education
23006.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

PHYSICAL EDUCATION: In an ordinary university, you’d be lifting medicine balls. Here at U. Mad Scientist, we do something similar, but by ‘medicine balls’ we mean ‘octopi’, and by ‘lifting’ we mean ‘forming a conga line with.’ Your opponent’s basketball team has eight legs to a man… to get your team to win, you’ll need lots of peanut butter.

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23007.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Medicine
23007.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

MEDICINE: It was a dark and stormy night. Thunder crashed above. Deep in the laboratory at Mad Scientist University's School of Medicine, the doctor unwrapped the bandages. The assistant shuddered at the gruesome sight and asked, "Do you really think you can get your insurance to pay for it?"

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23008.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Physics
23008.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

PHYSICS: Your current assignment is to become incorporeal. The Physics department is doing experiments on how to walk through walls and survive impacts. With enough depleted uranium, you would have no problem making someone incorporeal, but you haven't quite figured out how to keep your test subjects alive...

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23009.description:
Super Tank I is an expansion to SPI's Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century game. Super Tank is more than just an expansion of SPI's game, however, it is a complete revision of the infantry rules. Armored Vehicle rules are mostly in SPIs's rules folders for Tank. The infantry in Super Tank are played sequentially while the vehicle and gun units remain simultaneous. This makes large numbers of infantry easier to game...

The hexes on the large map are one inch to allow play with 1/285 miniatures.

The player will find that he has all the units he needs for all WWII types of attack and defense, including cavalry, machine guns, mortars, bridge laying AFV, rocket launchers and many other new types of units. Super tank is truly a combined arms game.

Game components include one 34" by 54" map (!) two mini 11" by 17" plotting maps, two Terrain and combat tables, eight (!) 11" by 14" die cut counter sheets (448 infantry, 960 Armored Vehicles) one booklet of rules, and three zip Lock bags.

Game includes just about every tank made by anyone in WWII, each unit rated for Front, Side and Rear armor, as well as AP/HE factors, Range and Movement. An awesome game!

Expands:

Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century
23009.name: Super Tank I

3574.name: Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century

23010.description:
This 40th anniversary collector's edition was published in 1999 to mark the fortieth anniversary of the original game of Risk. Parker Bros describe it as a "deluxe" anniversary edition. It includes a redrawn world map and each gameboard carries a unique number denoting the "limited edition" status of each set. The "battle dice" are a special edition and the armies are die cast miniatures, each army being provided with a drawstring pouch for storage. Each set carries a special certificate of authenticity and there is little doubt that many sets have been purchased as collectors' items rather than for ordinary play.

Re-Implements:

Risk
23010.name: Risk: 40th Anniversary Collector's Edition

23012.name: A History of Board-Games Other Than Chess
23012.description:
This 267-page history of the world's games is divided into nine chapters plus appendices. A two-page table near the end summarizes the distribution of games in countries across both history and the globe. Murray categorizes games according to their general goals: "Games of Alinement and Configuration;" "War-Games;" "Hunt-Games;" "Race-Games;" and "Mancala" (four types). Each major category is sub-categorized further. The text richly describes multiple games in each category, offering ample black-and-white illustrations to help the reader visualize lesser-known games.

Excellent book re-published by Oxbow Books in 2000 (ISBN-10 0-19-827401-7 -- ISBN-13: 978-0198274018), but once again out of print.

23013.name: A Taste of Transylville Terror
23013.description:
Our story revolves around the recent murder of Transylville's local beauty queen - Virgina Vestalata. Her killer sits amongst a group of unusual friends gathered together for an anniversary celebration, but that person has every reason to keep their involvement a secret.

If those present are able to deduce the murderer correctly, the guilty party will receive their just desserts, and Virginia's soul will be able to rest in peace.

However, if the group fails, the killer will escape prosecution, and Virginia's soul will spend an eternity in torment, endlessly searching for justice whilst trapped in the barren "Netherworld" -- The Land of Lost Souls -- a desolate place between this world and the next.

23014.name: Fuddy Duddy
23014.description:
Choices to make. Chances to take.

In this fast moving fun card game each player needs to be open to all possibilities. Be the first to collect 1,2,3,4 in one color and you've got a Fuddy and 20 points. Beware of dud numbers which count against your score unless you think you can collect them all and score a 40 point Fuddy Duddy! The first player to 100 points claims victory.

Available from http://www.made2Bplayed.com

23015.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Theater
23015.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

THEATER: It's the big night! The audience is all in place, and people are whispering to each other and shuffling in their seats. The plans are all set. The curtain lifts, and immediately the spotlights begin to hypnotize the public. The device is working perfectly...

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23016.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Winter Break
23016.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

WINTER BREAK: The stockings are hung by the chimney with care... sugarplums are dancing around the fireplace in what seems to be a primitive worship circle... but did the professor really say your assignment over the break was to visit every house in one night?

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23017.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Zoology
23017.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

ZOOLOGY: You've been following the herd for several weeks now. They're skittish, and hard to stalk, but it's going to be worth it. Here they come now... you catch the magnificent sight of your new two-headed giraffes galloping across the Savannah. Who knew it would be so rewarding to create a new species?

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23018.name: A Backfull of Bullets
23018.description:
Our story is set in the dusty mining town of Tombstone, Arizona, and involves the brutal murder of the infamous outlaw Jesse James, who has been mercilessly shot in the back, whilst taking a bath in his room at the Crystal Palace Hotel.

Jesse and his brother Frank, who both carried huge bounties on their heads, had quietly slipped into Tombstone the previous night, in order to participate in the celebrated
- Annual Tombstone Poker Tournament -
This notorious game, run by saloon owner Poker Alice, always takes place under a shroud of secrecy and is strictly an 'invitation-only' affair. Despite intense public speculation, the exclusive 'high-roller' guest list always remains a closely-guarded secret until play is just about to start.

However, just an hour before this year's game is due to begin, and shortly after Frank's own entrance into the saloon causes no small commotion amongst the eager spectators, four loud shots ring out from Jesse's room on the first floor.

Amidst the ensuing chaos, the murderer quickly escapes unnoticed from the bedroom window and leaves few clues as to their identity.

However, once the initial confusion subsides, Frank, soon realizes that his brother's killer must be amongst the other players due to take part in that night's game, as they were the only ones who knew that Jesse was in town at the time of the murder.

In a desperate attempt to discover the killer's identity before the trail goes cold, Frank quickly devises a high-risk game of 'truth-and-dare', carefully designed to lure the unknown murderer into taking the biggest gamble of their whole life.

If Frank is right, his 'winner-takes-all' challenge may well just tempt Jesse's killer into staking everything they've got to lose, in a daring attempt to seize all they could wish to win.

23019.name: Speakeasy Street
23019.description: The Mayor of Chicago is hosting the event of the year at the Hard Knock Café. Everyone who is anyone will be there and you don't want to miss out. The year is 1926 and the times are roaring! It is not unusual that crime runs rapid in this section of the city, but with all the big names attending, security is bound to be very tight. You decide this is as good a time as any to check out the infamous Hard Knock Café. However, be prepared to experience all that there is to be had in the dark underworld of Speakeasy Street , including a murder!

23020.name: Stranded
23020.description: Stranded brings together an unlikely cast of characters who find themselves trapped between fate and chance. An eccentric family becomes the only hope for rescue for a bus load of weary travelers. But when a murder takes place and with the killer still among you, panic and accusations abound. You must now sift through the clues and a web of lies and deception to solve the mystery of Stranded.

23021.name: Power, Plots and Pistols
23021.description:
Our story revolves around the horrific murder of Lord Henry Blacksnake, whose body has been found lying next to his severed head, on the floor of the Great Hall of Buckingham Castle.

As confusion reigns in the darkness, the Night Watch immediately seals off all castle exits and ensures that no one leaves. A fretful night of fear ensues, but fortunately, dawn sees the coincidental arrival of self appointed Witchfinder General Matthew Hopkins, who immediately assumes control of the situation, and, suspecting foul play, calls for an Inquisition of those characters found within the castle walls.

For those involved, the stakes could not be higher, as Hopkins decrees that the person selected by the others as being the likely murderer, will be immediately taken to the dungeons for a period of relentless torture at the master inquisitor's hands, until they are ready to admit to their guilt.
Hopkins is confident the guilty party will be found, as his tried and tested methods have yet to fail!

23022.name: A Case of Treasure and Treachery
23022.description:
Our story revolves around the recent murder of Captain William Kidd, one of the Caribbeans' three leading pirate warlords. Shortly before his murder, Captain Kidd experienced an overwhelming sense of his own impending doom. He immediately took steps to settle his affairs and requested that, in the event of his premonition being proved true, his attorney should call a meeting of his closest associates, a group from amongst whom he was sure his killer would emerge.

Captain Kidd was not only a man of foresight and cunning, but he was also a shrewd judge of character and was willing to risk everything, to ensure his killer would be brought to justice. In an attempt to expose his killer, he devised the most fiendish of challenges: one which he was sure his killer would find impossible to resist!

23023.description:
Course Packs add 56 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

SPRING BREAK: Get across the country for free! Have a night you'll never forget! Create a secret lair! All typical hopes for the Mad Scientist University student on spring break. Grab a lei and a snorkel and some radioactive isotopes and have fun!

Expands:

Mad Scientist University
23023.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Spring Break

23024.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: PSI PHI
23024.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

PSI PHI: Mad Scientist University's oldest and most prestigious club has accepted you to their ranks, but only if you can defeat the tyranny imposed by the space-time continuum. To show your dedication, you must use video games to get to the store, rather than the commonly accepted method of going to the store to get video games.

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23025.description:
This Knizia 2 player game was originally released in issue 17 of Games Unplugged magazine in June 2002. Shoot Out was re-released in February of 2012 as a bonus item in the DVD Going Cardboard: A Board Game Documentary.

It is high noon in Silver City, Texas.

Your opponent faces you on the other side of the street. Deadly Silence. Step by Step you edge closer towards your foe. Your hand wavers above your gun-belt.

The game plays from duel to duel until one player picks up cards with a total value of 14 or more. On each turn a player may move(closer to his opponent) or shoot(you have 2 guns: a colt and winchester rifle). Optionally either player may choose to end the duel and retreat(picking up more ammo).
23025.name: Shoot Out

23026.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Independent Study
23026.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist Universitycore game.

From the publisher:

INDEPENDENT STUDY: Ever ______ with _______? Want to take a course on _______? Wish _______ offered an advanced ______ program? Now ______ can _______with the _______ of them, by enrolling in Mad _______ University's independent study program!

Contains 50 blank cards you can use to explore your own ideas.

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23027.name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Home Economics
23027.description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

HOME ECONOMICS: Since the dean of the Mad Scientist University Home Economics department has been captured by the government, it's a good thing we have enough spatulas to raise money for the school to hire someone new. We need someone with a good sense of how to be an evil genius and still maintain the proper decorum every upstanding demagogue needs. Manipulative manners, sinister style, and corrupt charisma are all required. Apply within.

Expands:

Mad Scientist University

23028.name: Zombie Dawn
23028.description:
Zombie Dawn is Mystic Eye Games' game of survival horror. The object of the game is simply to be the first player to cross the zombie infested playing field or if you’re into sporting events, see how many zombies you can take down before they take you down. Zombie Dawn can be played solo or with a few friends.

17-pages. Written by Kenny Lewis (author of Giant Monster Rampage).

To play Zombie Dawn you will need the following items:
This rulebook
A horde of zombie (or other monster) miniatures (at least 50), and one survivor miniature per player.
A copy of the survivor record sheet or a blank piece of paper
Pencil
Tape measure or similar measuring device marked in inches
At least three 10 sided dice.

Purchasable download.

23029.description:
You are invited to the "Most Likely" Club banquet at Hollywood High School. But when you arrive at the Hardest Rock Cafeteria, you discover that a fire in the science lab turns out to be arson. And test answers are missing from the principals office. As you assume the role of one of these eight cool characters and solve the mystery, you and your guests will enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward blackmail, theft and deceit.

FLETCHER BYSEPPS Voted "Most Likely To Sweat Professionally," Fletcher is a popular football star destined to play pro ball if only he can get a college scholarship. He has dated half the girls in Hollywood - but rawly more dun once. His friends call him "Hex."

JUANITA GREENCARDE Voted "Most Likely To Rule A Small Country" Juanita is the beautiful daughter of an elite Colombian importer. Sexy, mysterious and a real tease, Juanita Ekes to steal other peoples friends just for sport. Her current boyfriend is student body president Spence DeMonet.

DUNCAN FLUSHWATER A computer and math genius Duncan wants to use his skills to discover faster-than-light travel. He was voted "Most Likely To Warp." Back in grade school, tough kids would get their kicks by flushing his head. This earned him the nickname "Flushie." After changing his image, he is one of the most popular kids.

TANYA BUNSOFF A model for top bathing suit designers, Tanya's curvy body and pretty smile recently won her the tide of "Miss Malibu." She was voted "Most Likely To Be Worshiped From Afar." The target of much attention from the boys, Tanya has little interest in dating.

BERNADETTE DOWN Bernadette was voted "Most Likely To Hang" (in an art museum). Her recent work, Still Life on a School Bus, is now on display at the museum. Growing up on the streets of Hollywood, she has a tough-girl image. Always dressed in black, she is aloof and distant from most of her fellow students.

CAMERON KORDIER "Cam" was voted "Most Likely To Get Snubbed At The Oscars." His new student film, Silence of the Spam, is a documentary about cafeteria food, which has won much praise. Cam dates socialite Chantella Solle, which almost guarantees him a bright future in films.

CHANTELLA SOLLE A cheerleader with loads of enthusiasm, Chantella was voted "Most Likely To Sign Autographs." Raised in The Valley, her life changed when her mother gained control of 19th Century Weasel Films and bought a mansion in Bel Airhead. Chantella can't resist a man with a camera and is dating Cam Kordier.

SPENCE DEMONET The dashing student body president, Spence was voted "Most Likely To Own California." In addition to being a swell guy, he is also a local hero, having rescued school mascot Murray the Mink from a construction site. Spence's girlfriend is Juanita Greencarde, the sexiest girl in high school.

Includes cassette tape which reveals the details of the murder, diagram of Hollywood High School with a map of Hollywood & vicinity, host's guide & instructions, 8 guest invitations & envelopes, 8 player clue manuals containing secret information for each player, 9 sealed secret clues, police investigation sheet, name tags, and a Hollywood High photo album
23029.name: How To Host A Teen Mystery: Hot Times At Hollywood High

23030.description: DaVinci's Mancala is an intelligent adaption of DaVinci's Challenge to classic mancala. Probably the first mancala with tile placement and pattern building. Subtle strategies guarantee an excellent challenge.
23030.name: DaVinci's Mancala

23031.name: Toxins
23031.description:
A roll and move game that has some resemblance to Rail Baron.

Set in the distant future when toxic waste has become a major problem, the players take the role of delivering toxic waste to waste dumps. Players roll for random destinations and move along a network of roads in a fashion similar to Rail Baron, but event tables and ownership of the dumping grounds rather than the segments of the road network set it apart.

The components are low quality.

23032.name: Wendo
23032.description:
Wendo comes with a wooden board (with holes in a hexagon shaped pattern) and 18 wooden cylinders in black and white. The underside of all cylinders is marked yellow.

The pieces start at the edges of the board with their markings face-down and are moved in turn towards the center of the board. When they reach the center they are turned over and if they are jumped from another piece they are removed from the game.

The player who first removes his pieces wins the game.

23033.name: Push
23033.description:
Push comes with a wooden board with 25 holes in it and 48 round discs in 4 colors.

Players in turn shoot their discs from the edge of the board trying to land them in the holes. The holes in front of each player score different points depending on how far they are located from that player.

23034.description:
Blox comes with a 4x4 wooden board and 16 tiles (8 yellow and 8 orange) marked with a line on the back side.

In the basic game the players remove a tile from the edge of the board and then re-insert it on the board from another edge sliding the tiles in between horizontally or vertically.

The objective of the game is to connect all 8 tiles of their color together.

The game comes with 3 different variants increasing in difficulty: the players must not only connect their 8 tiles together but the lines on their tiles must also connect!
23034.name: Blox

23035.name: Räuber und Gendarm
23035.description:
The thrilling detective game - who will catch the robber? The stocky robber hides in a house, up a tree, under a bush or in a rainwater butt. The detective is close on his heels.
The hunt grows more exciting every minute. Luck and a clever combination of clues will help to catch the thief.

Two players lay out the robber's trail with colored chips on the board, taking care not to let the other player see the secret track. Then both turn detective, trying by careful search of the colored drawings to find the trail laid by the other player. Winner is the one to spot the villain first.

3 variants are explained on the rules sheet.

23036.name: High Ground
23036.description:
High Ground is a hex-based expansion for Risk that takes place on a particular battlefield of the American Civil War. At the beginning of the game, each player gets to place 3 cities and 3 hills on the board secretly. The cities are not only the recruitment centers where new troops enter the board, but they also are the means of generating troops. The more cities you own, the more troops you receive each turn. The hills provide defensive bonuses and range increases for artillery. Four hills come preprinted in the rear of the battle field.
This game includes a 17" x 22" hex map, 6 City hexes, 6 Hill hexes, 8 Flag hexes, and a set of rules. Playing pieces are not included - the newer pieces from Risk (infantry, cavalry, and cannons) are required for play.

23037.name: Turn On
23037.description:
Turn On is a "game version" of the classic child's game of electricity. Players draw cards, set the timer, then attempt to follow the directions on the card within the allotted time (typically :15, :30, :45 or :60)

The "gimmick" in Turn On is that the instructions on the cards always involve the two players touching the metal bars projecting from the sides of the game, and at some point, each other. As the human body is capable of conducting a slight electric charge, completion of the instructions also completes the circuit and the game board buzzes (there is no sensate feeling - i.e. no one gets shocked) letting players know they have successfully completed the task. The team totaling the highest point total (based on the time allotted for completed cards), is victorious.

A number of blank cards also came with the original version to allow player "variations".

23038.name: Boum!
23038.description: In Boum! players compete in a closed arena, planting bombs against each other. Boum! uses simple and easy-to-learn rules, and different special powers guarantee a great variety of different tactics to the game. No player is eliminated until the end of the game, and situation reversals are frequent.

23039.name: Petcha Didn't Know
23039.description:
From the publisher's web site:

The pet trivia game with a puzzling twist!

Get to know our friends in the pet world as you race your human friends to complete your jigsaw puzzle in this question and answer game. The categories of Birds & Fish, Cats, Dogs, Horses, Reptiles & Amphibians, and Small Animals are packed with information that we Petcha Didn’t Know! True or false: a frog can breathe through its skin. If you said “true” you get to add a piece to your puzzle. Some easier questions are designated especially for younger pups.

For 2 to 5 Players

No. 6613
Ages 6 & Up

23041.name: USA Any Way
23041.description: This is similar to tic-tac-toe and played on the 3x3 grid. The big difference is that each player has only three tiles: U, S, and A. Players take turns placing their letters onto the tic-tac-toe board, IN ORDER (U, S, then A). After all 6 letters have been played. Players take turns moving their letters IN ORDER. When a player gets their three tiles in a row, in order (backwards is okay, ASU) that player wins.

23042.name: Boating Trivia
23042.description:
Trivia game that is all about boating. Game can be 3 different ways, but players primarily roll and move around the board answering boating or boating related questions.
Some sample questions:

Who Was the author of Moby Dick?

A boat whose bow and stern have dropped from the original shape is called?

How many points are there on a compass?

What color are Sternlights?

Away from the direction the wind is blowing is called?

Which wind creates a smaller wave - On-shore or Off-shore?

The voyage of the Mayflower to America took a)1 year, b)18 months, or c)67 days

A ship's journal is called a _______

The name of a person in charge of a commercial vessel is called?

Includes game board, 1 six sided die, 6 metal playing pieces (anchor, propeller, etc - all boating related), 2 boxes of trivia questions and answers, and instructions<

23043.name: Big Deal: Noah's Ark Card Game
23043.description:
Another in the "Big Deal" series of card games from Patch Products...

From the Publisher:

How good is your memory? Play Noah’s Ark and get your mind working! Take turns finding pairs of animals that Noah took along on the Ark. You’ll want to keep playing over and over… for 40 days and 40 nights!

Instructions in English and Spanish.

No. 6619
Ages 4 & Up

23044.name: Das große Spiel um 15%
23044.description:
Obviously produced at Ravensburger, as some of the components and the plastic box insert have the exact 1979 "Hare and Tortoise" form, this is a rather dull dice-driven game made from a publisher of German yellow press and TV magazines. Theme of the game (title translates to "The game around 15%") is the run of four advertising agencies "for 15%" of their customer's budget.

High-quality game components, but very little fun mainly coming from event cards like: "You have totally misunderstood the briefing, return to square one.".

23046.name: Legemax
23046.description:
One of Wolfgang Kramer's first published games - completely un-themed. He goes uncredited here - the mechanisms - connecting targets on the board with plastic sticks, the targets are determined by drawing cards - were reused in some of his later games (Spuren im Busch, Expedition, Auf Achse/Convoy).

Re-implemented by:

Schatzsucher

23047.name: Big Deal: Stuff the Stockings! Card Game
23047.description:
Another in the "Big Deal" card game series from Patch Products...

From the Publisher's web site:

Holiday card game fun!

Deal the cards, look for matches and don’t be left with the LUMP OF COAL!Look for pairs of toys and goodies! Stuff the Stockings plays like a long-time favorite, so you’ll have sleigh-loads of fun trying to find the most pairs and leaving your friends with the LUMP OF COAL!

For 2 to 4 Players

No. 6615
Ages 5 and up

23049.name: Hedbanz for Kids
23049.description:
From the Publisher's web site...

The quick question game of “What am I?”™

Am I a chicken? How about a bicycle? In this goofy game you never know what you are until you start asking questions! Figure out if the cartoon on your head is an animal, food or a household item. Everybody knows but you!

For 2 to 6 Players

No. 7376
Ages 7 & Up

23050.name: Cross Country Race by Land, Air and Sea

boardgameversion.190264: Chicago Game Company English First Edition

23050.description:
The game is a race from Kansas City to New York. It is a spin and move game from 1911.

Planes and Cars start the race in Kansas City and Boats are placed initially in Chicago. All Aeroplanes (sic) must always move using Black Lines, Automobiles using Green Lines and Boats using Red Lines. You can change modes of travel at any common station as long as there is a conveyance that is available and not in use by someone else. Changing from one mode of transportation to another uses up your turn. Lots of things can happen to you on your way across the country. (well half a country)(see some of the pictures for examples)

All pictures of the game come from DAN also known as(treasuresof-yesterday)an EBAY seller who had the game for sale. I saw the game and wrote him asking for permission to use his photos and he kindly game that permission to me.

23051.name: Kookie Chicks
23051.description:
From the box:

'An egg rolling contest with crazy, wobbly "Kookie Chicks" and weighted eggs. Players use magnetic wands to control the chicks as they bump, roll & knock the eggs into the nest of holes in the center of the platform. Each player has two eggs but there are only three holes. As much fun to watch as it is to play. "Kookie Chicks" is hilarious action from beginning to end.'

23052.name: Duell der Elemente
23052.description:
Two players measure in a Magicians duel. The cards used are open on the table and form a player's hand of spells. By skillful play the players try to score victory points for fire, water or air and develop their supremacy.

3rd Place 2006 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.

23053.description: A game about coffee planting and selling in Guatemala. The game uses two boards, representing plantations and markets. Players try to produce different kinds of coffee to ship to Europe. The market overseer decides where and if players can buy roads, huts, workers or ships or if scoring takes place. The scoring track also has a marker on it which moves ahead. The game ends when a player caught up with the marker on the scoring track.
23053.name: Guatemala Café

23055.description:
Dragons of Kir is an exciting, fast-paced, two-player strategy board game. The object of the game is to strategically place tiles that deflect one of the four constantly moving dragons into your opponent's war tent while defending your own.

Colorful tiles, representing the forces of nature and the forces of man, interact with the dragons and influence their movement. Clever tile play creates an ever-changing landscape where opposite edges of the board connect.

As quickly as one marauding dragon is deflected another may threaten you. Players must balance both offense and defense in order to succeed.

The game play is quick and offers a different experience each time you sit down to play.

Dragons of Kir is a themed version of Darter, which won the 2006 Origins Vanguard
Innovative Game Award at Gama, with some new tiles and different rules.

4 Player Wood Expansion Set adds rules for 3 and 4 players, wood dragons
and war tents, and introduces the dragon token.

Re-implements:

Darter
23055.name: Dragons of Kir

23056.description:
As described by the publisher:

Whirligig, The Musical Chairs Game inspired by Art Linkletter on his famous "House Party" program . . .

The twelve bears sit in the inner "tubs" as the Whirligig turns. When it stops, players scramble to put the twelve bears into the 11 outer "tubs". Each new "whirl" - there is one bear less, until there is only one - the winner!"

The whirligig is lazy-susan type object with small cups or "tubs" to hold small plastic bears. Players take turns rotating the whirligig, which makes music as it turns. Players are encouraged to sing a song while rotating the whirligig.
23056.name: Whirligig

23057.name: Mysticards: Deck of Ancients
23057.description: The first expansion to Mysticards: Deck of Dragons. The deck is a stand-alone game containing 60 all-new cards with the same rules as the Deck of Dragons. It also contains rules on switching cards between the decks to create new decks. With one copy of Deck of Dragons and one copy of Deck of Ancients it will be possible to create 16 unique decks.

23058.name: Reaction, The Game of Molecules
23058.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Reaction, The Game of Molecules, is a card game that lets you flex your intellectual muscle. Science geeks and regular folk alike will enjoy Reaction's fast pace and competitive spirit, along with the high-quality components.
To win, be the first to build the most molecules from the element cards you hold in your hand, and score the most points. It's that simple!

Players take turns drawing cards until they can create molecules from the element cards in hand. When a player can build a molecule, they lay it out in front of them on the table. Opponents can add onto the molecule to turn it into a different molecule, or they can destroy it with a Bunsen Burner card.

The object of the game is to be the first player to run out of cards and also score the highest number of points from the molecules they created.

What's Included:

Reaction includes the following high-quality components:
-- 100 unique clear plastic playing cards
-- A dry erase marker to "multiply" elements when creating complex molecules
-- Game Instructions
-- Helpful chart of common Molecules to make the game easy to play for everyone
-- High-quality outer box to store all items within

For two or more players, ages 8 and up. Created, designed and marketed in USA. Printed in China.

23059.name: Back & Forth
23059.description:
Another of the "Games on the Go!" series of games from Patch Products...

From the Publisher:

The Turn Takin’ Silly Sentence Makin’ Game!

Pick a partner, then roll the dice to determine your Target Word. Now, the two of you have to get other players to guess it. The trick is, you and your partner have to take turns, word by word, to form a sentence!

EXAMPLE
Player 1: Monkeys
Player 2: Eat
Player 1: This
Player 2: Yellow
Player 1: Fruit

Target Word: Banana

For 4 to 6 Players

No. 3508
Ages 8 & Up

23060.name: Rotkäppchen
23060.description:
A fairy tale game for 2 or 3 kids from 5 to 9 years

Each player is either Rotkäppchen (Little Red Riding Hood), the Wolf or the Hunter. Each player has another goal:
-Red Riding Hood wins, if she reaches her granny's home before the hunter captures the Wolf
-The Hunter wins, if he captures the Wolf before Riding Hood reaches her granny's home
-The Wolf wins, if he captures Red Riding Hood, before she reaches her granny's home

Three houses, some trees and a bridge, all made from wood, can be placed more or less randomly on the board, which has a 16 by 16 squares printed over a forest seen from bird's view. A dice is thrown for movement - whenever the dice shows a "K" (for "Karte" or card) an event card is drawn (there are different event cards for each character).

23061.name: Madcap Marathon
23061.description: In MadCap Marathon, players each have a different obstacle course and race their balls to the center. Players weave, shoot, and bounce their balls through mazes and other bumpy obstacles to be the one with the most balls in the goal before time runs out.

23062.name: Warfighter 101: The Guards
23062.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The Warfighter 101 System

The Warfighter Series is a played on maps with 1 hex = 1000m. Pieces are platoons/sections, with some single command vehicles. The innovative ZOC system allows players to establish fires while movement is taking place. Combat is resolved using one of three different tables, depending on weapons systems. Game turns represent 10-15 minutes. Games typically last 40-60 minutes for Warfighter 101.

Warfighter 101: The Guards

This new game features new rules for civilians, a British infantry battalion, government militia that switches sides, and 4 geomorphic maps. Demonstrate the actions of a British light infantry battle group in sub-Saharan Africa, including several unique new mechanics that deal with civilian populations and the ability of insurgents to hide within the population. Tribal politics also play into the scenarios.

23063.name: Alesia 52 B.C.: The Jurassian Hypothesis
23063.description:
From publisher:

Alesia 52 B.C., the Jurassian Hypothesis is a wargame (for 2 or 3 players) published by Canons en Carton, it includes two A3 color maps, 408 color counters a rules and scenarios booklet with historical notes.

Alesia, 52 B.C., the Jurassian Hypothesis does not pretend to provide a response to the question of finding the site of the decisive battle between Julius Caesar and Vercingetorix. Basing itself on the rules published in Vae Victis n°21, the game simply proposes a new sort of " What if ?" : how does one explain the sequence of events in the battle if it had occurred at the Jurassian site discovered by André Berthier? : Let's entertain ourselves by comparing the situation and the nature of the fighting with the two maps (the site of Alise and the site of Syam / Chaux-des-Crotenay) and let's forge an opinion. The game of history is a discipline which seems to have been invented for this, does it not ?

23064.description:
Description from publisher's site translated by Babelfish (with some editing):

"A crazy robber was seen fleeing into the woods. The players must find him and return the loot he stole. But this is not so easy, because the robber is difficult to locate in the woods. The player, who sights the crazy robber most frequently and recovers the most loot wins."
23064.name: Der verrückte Räuber

23065.name: Archäo
23065.description: Players are archaeologists trying to find valuable objects on different continents. In this game from Bernd Eisensteiner it's not only trying to find desired coins or amphorae, but also about sabotaging other players sites.

23066.name: Strike Force: Hunter
23066.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Strike Force Series

Designed to introduce a novice wargamer to conflict simulation, these games rely on familiar mechanics from other games you may have played to allow players to focus on strategy instead of learning new rules.

Strike Force: Hunter

A quick and dirty game of chasing bad guys, Strike Force: Hunter casts you in a dual role. You are trying to capture your opponent's terrorists while simultaneously attempting to infiltrate your own into his city. This game mixes "Concentration" with "Stratego" and offers several different ways to win... or lose. The entire file is 4 pages. There is a map, a set of markers to be cut & folded, and 2 pages of rules.

23067.name: Grand Slam
23067.description:
Elaborate late sixties design consisting of a large plastic play mat about 40" square suspended off the ground using metal rods and wooden posts. There is a centrally located raised plastic bowl type structure used for scoring.

Players have 3 thick plastic pucks which they place on the plastic play surface in designated positions. Players must in turn try to whack these up into the scoring bowl (2 points/5 points in the center) using the equipment provided (tiny hard paddles on long wooden sticks). Pucks that fall through certain holes in the play mat are eliminated.

The player with the highest score when all pucks are either in the scoring bowl or have been eliminated is the winner.

23068.name: Sangokushi Taisen
23068.description:
Sangoku Taisen (roughly translates as "Battles of the Three Kingdoms") is one of a new generation of hybrid network games that have recently been introduced in Japan. These games combine arcade gaming, collectible card gaming, and board gaming. This must be played at the arcade and cannot be played at home. The machines have a sensor board which recognizes cards and their placement and movement.

Sangoku Taisen is a real-time battle simulation based on the Chinese novel "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms". At the beginning of the game, you place your cards, which represent your units, on the board. Once the battle begins, you move the cards on the board to attack your opponent's units or fortification. The sensors in the board are capable of recognizing the cards you place on the board and are very responsive to movement and facing. The game ends when one player's fortification is destroyed, or when time runs out.

23069.name: Monogramz
23069.description:
In Monogramz, 30 lettered dice are shaken into a tray which divides them into 15 sets of two. Each player's objective is then to list names of celebrities with the same initials as each 2-letter monogram. When the hourglass timer runs out, the lists are scored and unique names earns the player points.
Special symbols on some of the faces of the dice denote the following categories that the celebrities' names must belong to: Authors & Artists; Entertainers; Athletes; and World Leaders. Although these symbols restrict the choice of category, regarding letters they act as wild cards. There is also a further symbol denoting "Wild!", meaning any letter, any category.
The game ends after a set number of rounds, or when a player reaches a set number of points.

23070.name: Big Bluff Game
23070.description:
Simple variation of a generic card game. Extremely bright & colorful with amusing cartoon art.

The playing board is dominated by a large circle divided into seven sectors (each of which represents a game character) with a centrally located plastic spinner. There are 28 cards, four each of the seven zany characters that feature in the game.

The cards are dealt evenly among the players. A turn consists of spinning the spinner and noting which of the seven characters it is pointing to. The player must place between 1-4 cards in that character's section of the board. Opponents then have the option of 'accepting' that the player has placed the correct cards or 'challenging' the active player, starting with the player to the left.

If all opponents accept, the player's turn ends and the cards are left on the board. If any opponent challenges, the cards just placed on the board are revealed. If all are the appropriate character as spun and declared, the challenger must pick up all cards currently on the board. If the player however is caught playing an incorrect card, they must place all the cards on the board in their hand.

The first player to successfully place all their cards on the board is the winner.

23071.name: Mix 'N' Match
23071.description:
Each player selects one playing board which can be used either side up. Once a playing board is selected it must be used throughout the game.
Each player in turn takes one card from the draw pile.
The Draw Card is placed against the matching color on the playing board. Red goes with red blue with blue etc.
If that color is already covered on the playing board the draw card is placed in a discard pile.
The first player to complete 3 words in a row wins the game.
An excellent game for 4-8 years old to learn word making.

23072.name: Mersa Matruh
23072.description:
Mersa Matruh

This is an operational level game, for two players, of the battles that took place in North Africa, near the coastal Egyptian port of Mersa Matruh in late June 1942. After Panzer Army Africa (PAA) had defeated the British 8th Army in the Gazala battles, and had captured Tobruk, the newly-promoted German Field Marshal Rommel was intent on destroying the retreating 8th Army and advancing to Cairo. Initially Lt Gen Ritchie intended to mount a stand at Mersa Matruh but he was relieved by his superior General Auchinleck, the Commander in Chief, Middle East, and 8th Army was ordered to break contact with PAA and retire to the El Alamein defensive position. Can PAA stop the 8th Army from conducting an orderly retreat and destroy sufficient units so it can continue its drive to the Nile, or can 8th Army slip away from their pursuers, with minimal losses, so as to be able to regroup at El Alamein and halt the eastward march of the Axis forces?

Units are regiments/brigades with some battalions. Map scale is 4.8 Kms/hex and each of the six turns represents about half a day. Mersa Matruh comes with a full colour 11" x 17" map, 198 mounted color counters, rule book, roster sheets and charts in a ziplock bag.

23073.name: Reaper Fantasy Wargame Rules
23073.description:
Many people probably won't realize this miniature set was the most likely pre-cursor to Warhammer Fantasy Battle. The second edition was printed by Rick Priestly and Richard Halliwell in 1981.

Reaper was written for use with wargame figures and battles with upwards of 30 or so figures per side. Reaper is a flexible rule set which leaves quite a lot up to the imagination of the players.

23074.name: Labyrinth
23074.description:
Children are lost in the labyrinth and fall asleep! Their mothers try to get to their children and drive them to the exit.

But the labyrinth always changes and dead-ends and traps appear. So although it sounds simple, the game requires careful planning.

Labyrinth comes with a 50cm x 50cm wooden board, 100 wooden walls (plus 100 support rods), 12 children tokens, 4 mother tokens and 4 player markers.

23075.name: Happy Birthday Party Games Rodeo Relay Race
23075.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The Galloping Game of Hats & Horses.

Saddle up and get ready to ride! Two teams race their toy horses to see who can finish first. Can you gallop from here to there with a little horse between your knees and a mini-cowboy hat on your head? Sure would be fun to try, and sure would be funny to watch! Woohoo!

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 4 or More Players in Teams

No. 6730
Ages 4 & Up

23076.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The Ice Cube Party Game!

Freeze two ice cubes in the special molds and take one for your team. Now… try to keep it from melting. The catch? On your turn you may have to shake salt on it or maybe you’ll have to give it a shower under the faucet. It won’t take long before the ice cubes become a small puddle of their former selves. If your team can keep your cube the longest, you’re the coolest!

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 4 or More Players in Teams

No. 6731
Ages 4 & Up
23076.name: Happy Birthday Party Games Freezy Fun

23077.name: Babinského memoriál
23077.description: Roll and move game in which players are escaping from prison. It seems to have some pachisi and backgammon elements. Players have a set of pieces that begin the game in different cells. Cards are drawn when landing on certain spaces on the board, and allow a player to manipulate die rolls, avoid guards etc.

23078.name: Mage Warfare
23078.description:
Mage Warfare is a new CCG created by a NH teenager. After years of playtesting, it was brought to market in October 2005.

The story concept is that you are a Mage in the Exocosm, the plane of existence that surrounds and connects all realities. You can pull warriors and weapons from any reality to do battle for you. Thus you can fight with samurai, vampires, MechaClowns, angels, demons, Nexans, dragons, etc., etc.

The focus of the game is strategy. You play with three decks: Barracks, Armory and Spellbook and on each turn you choose which one to draw from. Combat has three ranges: Long, Medium and Close, moving through the ranges as you fight, with many ways to affect the battle. Long Range weapons give ground troops the chance to shoot down flyers and some weapons can be thrown at opponents. When you defeat an enemy, you can loot the weapons they leave behind.

The resource for creating your warriors, etc., is a product of your Mage's HP, as well as the damage you inflict on your opponent.

For more information including complete rules, card list and forum, go to http://www.magewarfare.com

23079.name: Barbie Meets Ken in the Game of Their Dreams!
23079.description:
"Barbie is planning a trip to an exotic location. She has such a fabulous lifestyle, she is spoiled for choice of ... six glorious places to choose from.

And getting ready for the trip can be just as much fun! Barbie has six things to collect before she is ready to meet Ken in the place of their dreams."

Circular gameboard has establishments Barbie must visit to complete her Collectors Card. The first player to collect all six items and arrive at their final destination is the winner.

23080.name: Counteract
23080.description:
"It challenges your judgment and defies your sense of balance!"

The game consists of a 20" plastic circular maze which is supported by a single central 18" rod connected to a tripod base. There are circular depressions around the circumference of the maze where steel balls are placed and thus affect the way the maze tilts.

There are nine balls in all - eight smaller steel balls and a larger 'counteract' ball which is placed in the maze. The counteract ball must be manipulated into a depression located at the center of the maze by careful placement of the steel balls around the perimeter. Players must move three steel balls per turn.

The first player who causes the counteract ball to roll into the central depression (the 'winner's circle') is the winner.

23081.name: HeroCard Cyberspace
23081.description:
From the website:

"In the future, control collective neural network is the center of power. Using an arsenal of programming tricks, firewalls, links, hacking, and sabotage, elite jackers battle in a turf war for dominance. This is Cyberspace.

Cyberspace is a dynamic two to four player HeroCard game"

This game uses the HeroCard system which has the same core conflict resolution rules for all the games that use it.

23082.name: Bloody Picnic
23082.description: Historical wargame, nominated for a 2005 Origins Award in the category Historical Miniature Game or Expansion.

23083.name: Strike Force: Hammer
23083.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Strike Force Series

Designed to introduce a novice wargamer to conflict simulation, these games rely on familiar mechanics from other games you may have played to allow players to focus on strategy instead of learning new rules.

Strike Force: Hammer

This game introduces a bit more combat, including tanks, scouts, commanders, and militia. Instead of hunting bad guys, you're trying to take control of your opponent's territory by getting your population into his city.

23084.name: RAFFLES: The Sophisticated Game of Chance
23084.description: In Raffles, players wager chips on the results of a throw of three 6-sided dice. Payouts vary from 180:1 for results of three of a kind, 3, or 18; to 1:1 for a throw total that within a given range, odd sum, or even sum. The goal is to accumulate the greatest value in chips. Game components include a number of small plastic chips, a cloth wagering surface on which players place their chips, three dice, and a paper dice cup. Corey Game Co. was a division of the Quality Paper Box Co. of East Boston, Massachusetts.

23085.name: Legenda: czas bohaterów
23085.description:
[English translation of the title: The Legend: Time of Heroes]
Ages ago, when lost forgotten countries were full of life, and terrifying monsters walked the earth you were born. Raised among stories you grew a desire to see the world. The time was named Time of Heroes, and let your journey be remembered as The Legend.

"LEGENDA: czas bohaterów" is an adventure boardgame set in a fantasy world. The game is played on a board made of 4 pieces that you can join in multiple ways. The players take the roles of the heroes journeying through the land of Ar'Andia in search of adventure, treasures and fame. The goal is for a player to reach a title of mightiest hero in one of 6 areas: strength, dexterity, courage, magic, knowledge or luck.

23086.description:
In a random place in Eastern Europe, travelers are gathering to fight the evil vampire.
There is a day/night cycle determined by a sand glass. In daylight, travelers move twice as fight as the vampire. During nighttime, it is the opposite.

The players must bring all 4 artifacts into the vampire lair to kill him and win... but they do not know which artifacts they carry until they reach the crypt, or when they are bitten by the vampire. But some artifacts are actually vampire cards, than can turn a traveler into a vampire, unless he gets a blood transfusion by a fellow traveler who has a compatible blood group !

The vampire wins if he can turn all travelers into vampires.
23086.name: La Chasse au Vampire

23087.description:
Box Hex is a Hex variant which is played on a three dimensional surface. The shortest paths of connection travel around the outside of the board - not through the center. There are four such paths: two for each player. This solves the strong first move advantage problem of regular Hex, in which there is only one shortest connection path, said path being shared by both players. There is no need for the pie rule in Box Hex.

In Box Hex, as in regular Hex, one connection must exist in a filled board, and opposing connections cannot exist simultaneously.
23087.name: Box Hex

23088.description:
¡No Pasaran! is a historical recreation of the Spanish Civil War using Europa map 23 contained in the Spain and Portugal Europa series module (1984). It is a two-player game, with one player controlling the forces of the Republic and the other controlling the forces of the rebel Nationalists. Both players attempt to force the other side to the point of collapse by occupying key cities. Special rules have been included to reflect peculiar regional and political problems of Spain in the 1930's. Three scenarios have been included for those not wishing to play the campaign game.

Counters unmounted.
This variant is approved for use with Game Designers' Workshop (GDW) Spain and Portugal module for Europa.

Rules and counters printed in The Grenadier 27, Jan-Feb 1986.

This Europa add-on was subsequently very much revised and expanded by the designers as the full-blown Europa series game For Whom the Bell Tolls in 1995 which covers the Spanish Civil War and possible involvement by Spain and/or Portugal in WWII operations initiated by the Axis or Allies.
23088.name: ¡No Pasaran!

23089.name: Schaf
23089.description:
This game in HABA's mini-spiel key chain series comes with two sheep (one black, one white), four green four-leaf clovers and a die showing a four-leaf clover on three sides and a wolf's head on the other three sides. Like other games in the series, the pieces are wooden and terribly cute, especially the tiny die.

To start, the two sheep are placed at equal distances from the box they came in. Varying this distance will determine how long the game is. During a player's turn, he can create a path to the box using up to four clover leaves (slight ambiguity in the rules here: initially the rules say 3 then say 4). However, before he can place each leaf, he must roll the die. Rolling a clover leaf means the player can continue to add clover leaves, or the player can stop and move his sheep ahead of the last clover leaf placed (i.e. nearer to the box). If instead a wolf's head is cast, the player's sheep is so frightened that it is unable to move that turn. The player whose sheep reaches the box first is crowned King of the Sheep and wins the heart of the woman shepherd, Edda.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>

23090.name: All at Sea
23090.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

All at Sea is a murder mystery game for 16 to 33 guests and one or two hosts.

Join us in a thrilling evening of plotting, mystery and treachery. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive All at Sea? It's up to you.

Who killed Captain Bayard - and why? Find out in All at Sea.
It is 1914 and the First World War has just broken out. On an American cruise ship in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, diplomats, dignitaries and the crew must grapple with not only the outbreak of war but also the murder of Captain Bayard.

All at Sea lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory pdf file (43 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests - plus details of how to buy the game.

23091.name: Dragon's Loot Dueling Dice
23091.description:
Dragon's Loot Dueling Dice

Components: 10 differently colored beads (jewels), a bag and 4D6. Each die has: Wizard, King, Dragon 1, Dragon 2, Dragon 3, Dragon 4.

All jewels start in the bag. Each player receives a die. Players roll their die at the same time. Player with the highest roll takes a jewel. If highest roll is a tie, tied players roll again until there's a highest roll. Rolling a King makes you put a jewel back in the bag (if you have any). Once all jewels are drawn, player with most jewels wins.

23092.name: Psychic Power II
23092.description:
The first New-Age PSI Game: Extra sensory development games

This very unusual game include six separate games designed to increase your personal psychic powers and develop the "sixth" sense everyone can possess. Each game can be played alone or in teams of up to 8 players.

The six games are:
- Radiesthesia
- Magnetism
- Precognition
- Clairvoyance
- Psychokinesis
- Telepathy

The package include:
- 1 folded board
- 2 decks of cards
- 2 wooden pendulums
- 2 wooden "symbol" dice

23093.description:
This is an expansion for Paris Paris, published in the Abacus Spiel catalog. Instead of picking a special route tile, players pick a tile with 3 stops on it, and keep it secret until the end of the game. You score points for however many houses you have at those stops, and lose points if you have no houses on them.

Expands:

Paris Paris
23093.name: Paris Paris: Zusatzkarten Expansion

boardgamehonor.8420: 2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

23094.description:
Welcome, dear Imperialists. It's the year 2415. The interplanetary federation (IPF) has done a great job in the last centuries. All necessary precautions have been taken to conquer this planet named "Steam". The core of the planet consists of a 6,500º Celsius hot source containing different resources, including water. It has taken over one hundred years to complete the first block of 42 shafts from the surface to the core.

But now the time has come. From every shaft surges the hot steam that is the basis of the production of raw materials. To be able to use and process this steam, platforms have to be placed over the shafts. Later, we can use the platforms to connect the water purification tanks. By using several tank extractors, we can harvest other resources like energy, ore, and quartz from the steam. These resources are important. You will need them to grow your steam empires. You will need to increase the capacity of your landing craft to transport your harvested materials off planet. Buy and sell the resources at the Trading terminal for profit, as currency is – like on earth – always in short supply on Steam. To help you in your endeavours, the IPF has placed several specialists at your command – but getting the specialist that you require may not be easy.

Planet Steam is a board game in which two to five players take the roles of entrepreneurs in a steampunk boomtown, racing to assemble equipment, claim plots of land, extract resources, and accumulate riches. After harvesting resources using tanks and converters, players must buy and sell those resources in a volatile and ever-shifting market. The one who earns the most income will, in the end, be victorious. However, only through shrewd resource management and clever manipulation of supply and demand can a player reign supreme!
23094.name: Planet Steam

23095.description:
The title (The bear is sleeping) is a well-known children's song in Norway and Sweden. The game was first released in Norwegian in 2002, and in a much improved Swedish version in 2004. In the original version, the players try to collect gold coins without waking the sleeping bear; in the later version they gather blueberries instead.

Before the game starts, circular tiles are randomly placed face down on the board. In the original only the central 20 spaces are covered, in the later version all 44 spaces (not counting the four starting spaces). Players roll the die and move their pawns on the board. If they land on a face-down tile, this is revealed and acted on, and then turned face down again. If it depicts 1, 2 or 3 coins/blueberries, the player may take that number of couns/berries from the pool. The remaining symbols differ between the editions:

Norwegian edition: If a bear tile is revealed, the bear wakes up, and all players currently in the lair lose one coin. If a player lands on one of the bear paw symbols (printed on some of the non-covered spaces, not found on a token), two face-down tiles may be swapped.

Swedish edition: If it is a bear tile, the player loses one berry. If players stop on a face-up troll tile, the player may pick up the tile and use it to defend against the bear. Face-up bear print tiles may be used to swap two face-down tiles around (so that if players remember where the 3-berry tiles are they can use this to their advantage).

When all coins/blueberries are taken, the player with the most coins/berries is the winner.

Contents of the Swedish version:
Gameboard
44 wooden gameboard tiles
10 spare wooden tiles
27 wooden blueberry tiles
4 pawns
1 oversized die, numbered 2-2-3-3-4-4
Rules

Contents of the Norwegian version:
Gameboard
20 cardbord gameboard tiles
20 cardbord gold coins
4 pawns
1 die (not stated if this is numbered 1–6 or 2–4)
(Rules are printed on the back of the box)

4 years and up (Norwegian version is given as 5+, but is actually slightly simpler than the Swedish marked 4+). Language independent.
23095.name: Björnen sover

23096.name: Soldiers with Repeating Cannon Game
23096.description: Soldiers with Repeating Cannon game by J Pressman & Co., Inc. Made in U.S.A. No. 1560. This game is from the 50's. This game comes with 16 standing soldiers, made of thick cardboard, and a wooden, spring loaded, repeating firing cannon. The cannon comes with 20 wooden bullets. Turn the crank and watch the bullets project themselves into the standing soldiers. Knock them all down and you win!!!

23097.name: The Killer Reunion

5204.name: Dinner and a Murder Mystery Games LLC

23097.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This murder mystery game is rated for Teen and Adult audiences. The murder does not take place at the party although there may be further murders that do. The main 12 characters are all couples very much in love. There are no affairs at all in this game. This game was created for church groups, class reunions or those looking for a VERY clean murder mystery game.

We also have a Mature rated Version. It is still relatively clean, but has more intrigue then the 'clean' version and it does have 1 past affair.

A Killer Reunion was written to be a little different than the rest of our games. First of all the main suspects are all couples very much in love. Couples will be working together at times to achieve goals. They may have some secrets from each other, but overall they will be working to protect each other. This gives the game a romantic flavor. This murder mystery game is what we would call a 'clean' game. There are no affairs & people are basically good. This game is great for church groups, high school & college reunions or others who are worried about the possibility of offending guests. It can also be used for older teen groups!

Another difference is that the murder happens before the game. Being a couples murder mystery we felt it would be too complicated to murder them both or only one. That is not to say that there won't be more murders during the evening. Those tend to happen in our games since we provide a lot of intrigue outside of the murder itself.

This is the same game as our Class of '57, but we removed all reference to year & school so that people could customize it to any year, decade or school. We have areas in the game that can be customized by you to perfectly match your event.

The 12 player version has 6 couples and we include our 2 Extra Character Packets to expand the game up to 32. The Extra Character Packets add a little quirky flavor to the party, but not all of these 20 extra characters may be suitable for conservative groups. (Remember... these are included FREE in the 12 player version, no need to purchase them!)

Home Page: http://www.dinnerandamurder.com/games/killerreunion.htm

23098.name: Death by Chocolate

5204.name: Dinner and a Murder Mystery Games LLC

23098.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Death By Chocolate is a game for 8-16 women with an optional 5 male characters. This kit is great for hen parties, bachelorette parties and parties where there are a lot of women and a few men. We will provide a free Chocolate Spa Recipes Booklet which you can use to make spa treatments and/or print to give to your guests as a gift!
You are NOT required to give spa treatments of any kind. This is optional!
Madeline Corman is hosting her daughters’ bachelorette party at the very exclusive Lady Godiva’s Day Spa. Lady Godiva’s spa is a chocolate lovers dream come true. A place where chocolate is not just an edible treat. Guests will experience body treatments made from the finest chocolates, while indulging in the most delicious and exotic chocolate treats.

Chastity Corman, daughter and sole heir of the Majestic Confectionery fortune is about to marry Miles Belvedere. Miles is the sole heir to the Belvedere Ship fortune. This marriage will create a true dynasty!

Home Page: http://www.dinnerandamurder.com/games/chocolate.htm

23099.name: Fabrication
23099.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

TEAM OBJECTIVE: Your team has 60 seconds, in a continuing story, to tell an outrageously tall tale. You, or one of your team members, must "work in" one of the Fabrication Lines selected from your game and try to stump your opponents for points. When time is up, the opposing team may now score by guessing correctly: WHO said
the line? and WHAT was the Fabrication line in your fabricated story. Some lines are real ZINGERS! Stump your opponents to earn DOUBLE POINTS with the ZINGER line. The team players with the most points are the winners, great fabricators and know Fabrication when they hear it!
Let your imagination run wild! But, in team play, if you suddenly get a "brain cramp" you may pass "Pass the Buck" at any time to another team player to pick up where you left off.
Contents: 100 Fabrication Line Cards,
100 Story Starter Help Cards, 3 Pass the
Buck Cards, 60 second sand timer,
score pad, pencil and easy instructions.
INDIVIDUAL PLAY OBJECTIVE: You have up to 60 seconds, in a continuing story, to tell an outrageously tall tale. You must "work in" the Fabrication Line selected from your game card and try to stump your opponents for points. When time is up, the opposing players may now score by guessing correctly: WHAT was the Fabrication line in your fabricated story. Some lines are real ZINGERS! Stump your opponents to earn DOUBLE POINTS with the ZINGER line. The player with the most points is the winner, a great fabricator and knows Fabrication when they hear it!

23100.name: Strike Force: Eagles
23100.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Strike Force Series

Designed to introduce a novice wargamer to conflict simulation, these games rely on familiar mechanics from other games you may have played to allow players to focus on strategy instead of learning new rules.

Strike Force: Eagles

Strike Force: Eagles introduces airmobile units that speed around the battlefield in their assault helicopters. Just like the other games in the Strike Force series, this one simplifies combat to make it accessible for non-wargamers, and will be a PDF download.

23101.description: This is a 2-card expansion for Knatsch/Knights, with a new goal (Six 6s), and an extra card (6) to help meet that goal.
23101.name: Knatsch: Katalog Edition 1

23102.description: This is the second expansion for Knatsch/Knights, published in the Abacus Spiele catalog, with two extra cards for the game. One card is a Queen, which can be used to win the game using the other new card, the "Wedding" goal.
23102.name: Knatsch: Katalog Edition 2

23103.description: This is the third expansion for Knatsch/Knatsch, published in the Abacus Spiele catalog, with two special cards to add to the base game. Once captured, the owning player may capture cards from the stacks by rolling a large or small straight (1-2-3-4 or 2-3-4-5, respectively) depending on the card. The player may still capture a card by beating its combination normally. The cards do not affect capturing cards from other players.
23103.name: Knatsch: Katalog Edition 3

23104.name: Space Huk
23104.description:
Space Huk is, as it says in the introduction, a "variable-player, limited intelligence, tactical, space wargame." (The 16 listed as the maximum number of players is not a hard limit - the minimum of 3 is correct as one needs 2 players plus a game master.)

The game is played with paper and pencil - players write their moves down and submit them to a game master, who keeps track of the positions and actions of all the ships. Play takes place in 3-dimensional space, and players must first detect opponents with sensors before firing on them. Optional rules provide for realistic movement (the basic rules ignore conservation of momentum), decoys, hyperspace movement, and gravitational wells.

At least two versions of the rules were printed, one in 1973 and one in 1974.

23105.name: The Battle at Durk's Well
23105.description:
The Battle of Durk's Well is a simple asymmetric wargame. One player controls settlers (led by Anders Durk) who have settled in a valley and the miners working nearby. The other player is a nearby wizard who sends a group of Orrks and Spooks to poison the well (on which both settlers and miners depend) and burn down the settlers' houses.

According to the designer's notes, the settlers and miners are inadvertently damaging the Orrks' and Spooks' environment, so it's not a simple good-vs-evil battle (although the background doesn't affect the gameplay to any great extent).

Components consist of a 4-part paper map (with hand coloring, it appears), paper counters, and a set of rules.

23106.name: Space War
23106.description:
Space War is a strategic space conflict game. The 2-4 players each start with a single home planet and must accumulate resources to build ships, capture additional planets (obtaining more resources), and eventually conquer the other players' home planets.

There are three types of ships that can be built, plus immobile (but transportable) star bases. Somewhat unusually, players must keep track of each ship's fuel and weapons, and have a ship stop off for refueling when it gets too low. The deck of cards adds events and such to the long version of the game.

The components consist of a board, 4 record sheets in plastic folders, crayons for the record sheets, a reference chart, a set of rules, a deck of cards, and 4 sets of pre-cut counters.

The game was also published (presumably with revisions) as Space War II.

23107.description:
The old dragon Drakon has captured a brave band of adventurers who have sneaked into her lair to steal her gold. But rather than eat them immediately, Drakon has decided to make it a game: Greed shall set one of the adventurers free. She sends the frightened adventurers into her magical, mad vaulted chambers, and the first one to collect ten gold from Drakon’s maze gets to go free. The rest get to be lunch.

Each turn, players must choose one of two options: (1) place a tile from their hand onto the board, expanding the dungeon; or (2) move their Hero to an adjacent tile. Many of the dungeon tiles have an icon that allows players entering that space to take a special action (for example, taking a piece of gold from the dragon's hoard, stealing gold from another player, or destroying a tile that is already in play).

This is the third edition of Drakon, and includes the following updates:

plastic miniatures are used for the heroes and the Drakon
new tiles are larger (measuring 2.5 by 2.5 inches) and have all new artwork
tiles include a combination of rooms from Drakon (second edition) and Drakon Expansion 1
new rules, variants, and player aids are provided
each gold piece now has a value between 1 and 3




In the basic game, the first player to earn 10 gold wins the game. Some variants provide different winning conditions.

Game last between 20 and 60 minutes.

boardgameversion.23938: Fantasy Flight Games Silver Line Edition

23107.name: Drakon (third edition)

23108.name: Starfight: Star Captains
23108.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The STAR CAPTAINS expansion set for the popular Starfight game is not a game itself, you need at least the STARFIGHT base rules in order to play this expansion.

This is not an advanced game, however, these rules will make the game last longer and add a bit of complexity to the whole mechanism.

With this expansion, your ships will now have a captain and a crew!

Some rules have been modified to work best with this expansion, however you can incorporate these modifications in your game even if you do not use the STAR CAPTAINS expansion.

This PDF contains
• A rule sheet
• 4 crew sheets
• The new fire modifier table

Expands:

Starfight

23109.name: Starfight: Expansion Pack I – ships
23109.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This is the first expansion to the Beer & Pretzel's Game STARFIGHT. The expansion features four new ships, and new weapon type. This is not a game itself, you need the Starfight© base rules in order to use this expansion. This PDF contains:

A rule sheet
Four ship sheets
Four ship screens
Four ship counters

The new ships are all armed with long-range disintegrators!

Expands:

Starfight

23110.name: Starfight: Expansion Pack III – ships
23110.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This is the third expansion to the Beer & Pretzel's Game Starfight©. The expansion features four new ships, and new weapon type. This is not a game itself, you need the STARFIGHT© base rules in order to use this expansion. This PDF contains:

A rule sheet
Four ship sheets
Four ship screens
Four ship counters
An exclusive torpedo die!

The new ships are all armed with torpedoes!

Expands:

Starfight

23111.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This is the second expansion to the Beer & Pretzel’s Game Starfight. The expansion features four new star maps. This is not a game itself, you’ll need the STARFIGHT© base rules in order to use this expansion. This PDF contains:

• a rule sheet
• Four star maps
• #5 Black Hole
• #6 Mines
• #7 Nebula
• #8 Stardust

Expands:

Starfight
23111.name: Starfight: Expansion Pack II – Starmaps

23112.name: Court in the Act
23112.description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Court in the Act is a murder mystery game for 13 to 21 guests and a host.

Join us at the court of Queen Elizabeth I of England for an evening of revelry, intrigue and murder. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive Court in the Act? It's up to you.

At Court in the Act you will discover the following:


Who murdered the Archbishop of Canterbury?
Why must Queen Elizabeth never marry?
Who wrote Shakespeare's plays?
What is the secret of Dr John Dee's magical powers?
...and can England be saved from defeat by the Spanish Armada?


Find out in Court in the Act!
Court in the Act
The Court of St James's Palace, London, in the reign of Queen Elizabeth I. All present have but lately arrived from the Royal premier of Master Shakespeare's latest rib-tickling comedy, Two Ladies of Venice. Now, the Queen makes merry and entertains her courtiers, guests, would-be husbands and envoys from foreign powers with a sumptuous banquet. But while all prepare to feast and frolic, dark clouds gather, the sound of war-drums is heard in the distance - and that dear old man the Archbishop of Canterbury, who surely had never an enemy in the world, is found brutally murdered.

Court in the Act lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.
