Four animals are placed on the circular board (sheep, cow, horse and pig). The rest of the animals are placed in the barn.

Next to each field on the board, a straw card is placed with the hidden items. On each of these an object from the farm is depicted. Of each item there are two cards.

Each player is dealt three cards with the animals to be collected. On each turn a player rolls a die and selects an animal to move. After the move, the straw card next to the animal is turned to show the item. The the player selects any other straw card and turns it as well. Following results can happen:

1. The items on the cards are the same, and the animal that was moved is one of the assigned ones. The player then takes the animal into his collection and ends his turn.

2. The items on the cards are the same, and the animal that was moved is not one of the assigned ones. The player then takes a new animal from the barn and places it on the board and ends his turn.

3. The items on the cards are not the same. The player then ands his turn.

After this all open straw cards are turned back again.

The player that has collected all his assigned animals wins the game.

Variant for younger players: The assignment cards are not used and whenever two matching items are found, the player takes the animal. When all items are taken, the player with the most animals wins.

23300.description:
Minotaur is a mini expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. The minotaur comes in blue and orange color, so it´s only usable in a 2-player game.

A rough translation:
The minotaur (stats: 4/3) is the prisoner of the labyrinth. He has no power leaving the labyrinth at all and besides the game start he´s forbidden to enter any starting zone fields. For 1 AP he breaks closed bars gates.

Came in the April 2006 issue of Spielbox magazine.

Expands

Dungeon Twister
23300.name: Dungeon Twister: Minotaur

23301.name: Der Bär ist los
23301.description:
Each player has to bring home his own three animals (a sheep, a pig and a goose). On every turn two dice are rolled, one to indicate the type of animal that has to be moved and one for the number of spaces the animal can move.

There is also a bear on the board that can be moved with the dice. If an animal lands on the space of the bear, it is sent back to the starting meadow.

Once an animal reaches the barn, it is given to the corresponding player (noted by the hidden color under the animal).

The first player to bring home his three animals (either himself or by the move of another player) wins the game.

23302.name: The Butterfly Game
23302.description: Fun and learning flutter in with butterflies! Designed by a school teacher, this colorful, engaging board game reveals a treasure trove of interesting facts about 25 North American butterflies. Players answer questions from butterfly information cards and collect tokens for correct answers. Learning takes wing as kids discover the many mysteries behind this beloved insect.

23303.name: Da ist doch der Wurm drin
23303.description:
This is a game for players 6 years and older. The goal of the game is to have the most apples without worms at the end of the game.

Players roll the die and pluck an apple showing the number they rolled from the apple tree on the game board. If there is no apple with the corresponding number left on the tree, the player can steal such an apple from another player. In any case, the player can look at the backside of the apple to see whether it has a worm.

The game finishes once all apples have been plucked from the tree.

Contents: 1 board, 24 apple tokens, 6 baskets, 1 die

23304.description:
Geneva, 1920: The League of Nations convenes for the first time. Proud to be the host for this august world body, Switzerland invites its champion axe-juggling troupe, "Les Bella Lieben Jolie De Von Giorno", to entertain the assembled delegates. Unfortunately, halfway through the demonstration, the Troupe goes insane and begins hurling axes into the audience, splitting head after head. The Secretary General calls for calm, but before he can order a recess, his cranium is split as well.

In "Oh My God! There's An Axe In My Head." The Game of International Diplomacy, the remaining Great Powers use the confusion to pass the gavel between themselves, conduct international business amidst the chaos, and generally try to shift the balance of world power while escaping a bunch of armed psychopaths.
23304.name: "Oh My God! There's An Axe In My Head." The Game of International Diplomacy

23305.name: Triple
23305.description: You're given a number and from the different number tiles you have you'll have to use exactly three and operate mathematically with them to acquire the given number.

23306.name: Church On The Way
23306.description:
Church On The Way sets out to loosely simulate the influx of new church plants into a city. Up to six players each decide on a church name and draw their first two leaders to add to their church of twenty members and a very small budget.

As the game progresses each church looks to increase their 'Holiness', 'Theology' and 'Holy Spirit' points through preaching different topics from the 'Preaching Track' (each of which give different variations of point provision - for example preaching on Biblical Truth gives +3TH while preaching on Serving allows an extra leader to be drawn next turn). Points can also be gained from buying equipment and events (buying Original Greek New Testaments gives a Theology bonus each turn for example).
These equipment and events can also be used to increase the size of the church (Church barbecues, Harvest Festivals, Bible Weeks etc)or to make your current members happier (doughnuts, china cups, quality tea, comfy chairs).

Make sure the church can afford to pay the rent of the pub meeting room it is meeting in and look for bigger and better buildings to rent and buy that are on the market!

However church life isn't always fun and roses, watch out for the potentially damaging "Event Cards". Some good, some bad, some indifferent, but all a talking point, as the churches look to grow, compete or work together in a game trying to balance between dry wit, in-jokes and a business simulation.

But which church is the most rounded and most developed by the time all the world's people groups have been reached?

23308.name: Pirates of the Caribbean: Trading Card Game
23308.description:
Sail in search of pirates plunder and swashbuckling adventure in the Pirates of the Caribbean Trading Card Game! Join the action as you clash cold steel in epic sword fights, encounter the monstrous sea Kraken, commandeer might sea ships and let loose an explosive broadside of cannon fire.

Utilizing the Quickstrike TCG system and revolutionary Chamber Card technology to strategically unleash your pirate’s hidden moves, the Pirates of the Caribbean TCG features lightning fast game play.

Each starter deck includes everything needed for 2 players: 60 randomly assorted cards, 2 chamber cards, 2 play mats with quick play guides, a rulebook and one Udeck carrying case.

The QuickStrike system is compatible with other games such as Avatar: The Last Airbender Trading Card Game.

23309.name: Harry Potter MagiCreatures Card Game
23309.description:
Collect Point Cards by trading creature cards with other players, until you gather six (6) of a kind. When the last Point Card is taken, the player with the highest score wins.

This game contains 7 types of Harry Potter creatures, each with a point card valued at a single value from 1 thru 7, and each with 6 cards for play (no point value). Therefore, there are 42 creature cards, and 7 point cards. The point cards themselves need to be won, and are not dealt out. The creature cards are the ones dealt out, and that players are trading blindly ("2 cards", for example), with other players while trying to collect a set of 6.

Along with the 42 creature cards are 3 other cards: Harry Potter, Hagrid, and a Dementor. These add extra intrigue to the trading & collecting.

23310.name: The Bible TCG
23310.description:
With the exception of the Bible itself no ministry tool in the world compares to the Bible Trading Card Game. The Bible TCG is a one of a kind, STRATEGIC, interactive card game, devoted exclusively to God's word and provides players a Biblical lesson/experience unlike any other. Throughout the game, players discover the biblical lands, recreate biblical events like the Crucifixion and Resurrection of Christ, the missionary journeys of Paul, the baptism of the Ethiopian treasurer and many, many more.

Every card in the Bible TCG features one or more biblical verses. Players who choose to memorize the verses in their play decks will quickly discover they have a major advantage for victory.

Pick up a Bible TCG deck today; then Pray,Read,Play!

23311.description:
Carrousel is a game without turns. The board shows a carrousel with seven spaces in a circle. Placed on this (on five adjacent spaces) are five different-colored horses. The game also contains a deck of cards, each showing three horses in different colors.

At the start of the game, each player is dealt nine cards and lays them out in front of herself. The object is then to make the three horses at the front of the carrousel be in the same order as on one of one's cards. When this happens, you get a point for that card (put it upside-down in a private score pile) and get to draw a new one.

There are a number of legal moves to make, like swapping the places of two horses, placing the last one first and so on. To score a card, you must perform a move to make the first three horses match one of your cards. If you make a move and they don't fit, you lose one point. If you're not fast enough, someone else will move something, messing up your plans.

The game has been illustrated by Stéphane Poinsot.

From the publisher's website:

Here's a strange merry go round! Its wooden horses, joking and mocking, have come to life and nothing can stop them for turning in any direction! If you want to ride, you'll have to catch them!

To play Carrousel, you don't have to be a knight, jockey or a cossack. A little speed and observation will do. Find the right color combinations and move your horses quickly before your opponents do it for you!

Carrousel is a game of speed and observation by Max Gerchambeaux who, when he's not cooking one of the best cassoulets in Paris in his restaurant, invents smart games for the whole family!
23311.name: Carrousel

23312.name: Free At Last
23312.description: This is a card driven wargame simulating the Civil Rights Movement set in the South in the 1950s and 1960s. This is a free print and play game with all files available for download from BoardGameGeek.

23313.name: El Tablero de Jesus
23313.description:
El Tablero de Jesus (pronounced 'Heh-soose') is a simple gambling game played on a 7×7 board with a pair of standard dice. Originally presented to the SCA (recreational medievalist) as a historic game from the 15th century, further research has found this to be a hoax. No evidence shows the game to have existed before 1971.

Players each roll one die, with the high roller going first. The first player places two coins in the two right most columns of his back row, while the losing player places five coins in the remaining columns on his home row. The first player then rolls both dice and moves any two coins up or down a column the exact number rolled. When a player gets two or more coins in adjacent columns on the same row (other then either home row) he may choose to take those coins and end his turn or continue rolling. If he takes the coins, then his opponent fills in the now empty columns with new coins on his home row and starts his turn. At any point if a player rolls 7, 11 or 12 their turn is over and the dice pass to their opponent. Also if you roll a pair of numbers that can not be moved (roll a 6 and none of the coins are in a home row) your turn is over. If at the start of your turn there are adjacent coins on the board, you may take them and pass the dice back.

The game ends when one player is out of money (or is no longer willing to lose more).

The game is most often played with alcohol instead of coins (if it ever was played with coins) -- filling shotglasses with beer or wine and moving those about instead. This can shorten the game, since the "currency" being exchanged is consumed as it is won. It can also balance the game, since the better one plays, the drunker he/she gets from drinking his opponent's brew, self-imposing a handicap. Many SCA-events run Tablero tournaments, in which there is usually a table limit of 2 beers (or 24-oz) set to keep the tournament moving (and the participants capable of competing).

In all versions of the game, house rules are as rampant and as varied as can be, as no "definitive" rule set exists for the game. When playing, make sure to agree to a rule set with your opponent beforehand.

23314.name: Slots n' Spots
23314.description:
According to the game box:
"As everyone knows, a slot machine is a mechanical device that consumes coins at a rapid rate. It's a game of pure chance...simply put in a coin, pull the lever and hope that the spinning symbols stop at the right combination. different combinations pay off at different odds. Charles Fey, a mechanic from San Francisco invented the slot machine. He made the first one (called "Liberty Bell") in 1895 and rented it to a saloon for 50% of its profits. Mr Fey obviously understood the motivation that causes people to enjoy losing.
Spot dice - the dice used in America's favorite game of chance, "Craps", can be traced back as far as 1573 B.C., back to the crude sticks, bones and shells used by primitive man.
Classic Games has taken these two basic gambling devices and combined them into a modern classic - " Slots n' Spots". A game in wich the outrageous chances of the "slots" are paired with the predictable(?) roll of the dice."

The game box contain:
- a dice cup
- 3 special dice
- 2 regular dice
- score pad
- Instructions

23315.name: Keno
23315.description:
Keno is a big game in most gambling houses in USA. Keno parlors have replaced Cocktail lounges in most of the resort Casinos.
Depending upon which historian you listen to Keno was either brought into this country by the Chinese in the early 1800's or it was developed from the Italian "Lotto" a descendant of the Italian National Lottery. Either way Keno became a fast and furious gambling game in the "dives" and "joints" that abounded in New Orleans around the mid 1800's. It soon made its way west to where money was to be won.
In the Classic Games' published version of Keno, each player choose from 1 to 15 numbers between 1-80. The points are awarded according to the number of hits made in a drawing of 20 numbers.

23316.name: Biwords
23316.description:
Biwords is the bilingual word game. Players are given English or French words and must try to supply their equivalents in the other official language.
The game contains 5,000 English and French words and short phrases ranging from familiar, everyday terms to the frankly very difficult. Score points are earned according to the number and difficulty of words that each player can identify.

23317.name: Quadular: The Ultimate Challenge
23317.description:
From the back of the box:

QUADULAR...The Prince shall be Crowned

In July, 1986, Mr. George Koltanowski, INTERNATIONAL CHESS MASTER and BLINDFOLD CHESS CHAMPION endorsed Quadular: Among his many remarks are: "One thing for sure, QUADULAR will make you think." "People of all ages can play and enjoy QUADULAR.

This game offers an entirely new concept in strategy. It's exciting, yet thought provoking.

Introducing the Prince: A newly conceived and designed playing piece that lends more majesty to the game. The Prince must make his way into another Domain in order to receive his Crown. Once Crowned, his strength multiplies and the course of play can change drastically. Should the Crowned Prince survive, he can become the new Ruler of his Domain.

QUADULAR The mind-stimulating game of the future

Contents: 1 Gameboard
Rules
4 sets of playing pieces (5 pawns, 2 rooks, 2 knights, 2 bishops, 1 queen, 1 king, 1 prince, 1 prince's crown....per set).

(c) 1987 HPH DEVELOPMENT, INC STOCK NO. HP 102

23318.name: Shift Tac Toe
23318.description: Two players play Tic-Tac-Toe on a "Connect Four" type board (meaning placing a disk sends it to the bottom first). On their turn, a player can drop a disc in, or slide a row one space to the left or right. Since the board is a 3x3, slides can sometimes send pieces out of the unit and back into regular play. The first to achieve 3-in-a-row is the winner.

23319.name: Snap Quiz
23319.description: A simple card playing game where players try to find answer cards to the question cards in their hand. Once found the player takes the completed question/answer set and places it in front of him. Winner is determined by the highest number or question/answer sets when the cards are exhausted.

23320.name: Mein buntes Türmchenspiel
23320.description:
This very simple game is for children of 3 years and older and is designed to teach color recognition. Each player has an empty pole and six wooden beads in the colors red, blue, green, yellow, orange and purple. On their turn the player throws a color die, and if they do not already have a bead of the color thrown then they place one on their pole. The winner is the first player to have collected a set of beads of all six colors. In a variant game, the beads are all placed in groups on the board, which shows a multi-colored worm. The beads must be placed on a player's pole in the same order in which they appear on the worm.

Similar to:

Rainbow Towers

23321.name: Space Shuttle
23321.description:
It is 20 years into the future and NASA is now defunct. The U.S. Government has decided to take their space shuttle program to the corporate level. Players take the role of one of several corporations vying for a fat government contract to build space shuttles for the U.S.A.

Objective
To be the first player to successfully launch a space shuttle by acquiring 20 or more lift-off points.

Contains
(6) Shuttle System Displays
(30) Display Tokens
(122) Cards

23322.name: Passport
23322.description: In this game the players travel around the board answering questions from around the world. Everyone gets their own passport and try to collect countries from each of the 5 continents. The game is in Norwegian.

23323.name: Multinational
23323.description: Multinational is a boardgame where the players have to grow their multinational company. This is done by buying stock in ten multinational corporations, and then influence stock prices by buying factories, buying countries and playing cards. All this in order to sell the stock at a better price.

23324.name: Krimi Total Fall 4: Jenseits der Schönheit
23324.description:
The latest case in the Krimi Total series. 8 / 9 players meet and take different roles in a detective story. All players (4 male, 4 female + 1 optional m/f inspector) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer (who is the only person, who´s allowed to lie).

A plastic surgeon was murdered before he could participate in a dinner party where he wanted to celebrate his induction into the hall of fame of plastic surgeons. His friends, colleagues and relatives are trying to find his murderer at the dinner party.

23325.name: Bowl-O-Rama
23325.description:
A bowling game which uses a "Magic 8-Ball"-type device to simulate each frame of the game. Results given by the ball range from "Strike!" to "Gutterball" to "Karaoke Break."

From the publisher:

"Finally there's a way to experience all the thrills of bowling without having to rent a pair of stinky shoes. Bowl-O-Rama is an exciting game for all ages that can be played alone or with multiple players. All you need is a Bowl-O-Rama ball and a scorecard and you're ready to roll!"

23326.name: Rivalry
23326.description:
In Rivalry each player controls a historical civilization and works to achieve supreme power through military, economic, and diplomatic means. Each civilization is entirely different from the others and has its own distinctive benefits and heroes. The game has no specific time period, so Alexander the Great can battle Rommel with his armies, while Montezuma can be played against Genghis Khan.
Rivalry emphasizes cooperation between players since individual civilizations will have difficulty winning alone. While predominantly a military strategy game, the historical flavor and distinctiveness between civilizations adds a role-playing element.

23327.name: Tuttu Juttu tuntemisleikki
23327.description:
Translates roughly to 'That's familiar' or 'A familiar story'

A party game for couples. In order to win the members of a couple have to know each other better than the other couples know each other. There are 400 question cards included. Can also be played by just one couple as a "solitaire".

23328.description: Another CCG from the mid-1990s that appeared in the wake of M:TG, but failed before it even got started. This one was put out by Edward Beard Jr., an excellent artist who has done quite a bit of art for M:TG cards. The set consisted of 90 cards, 30 in each category of Horror, Fantasy, and Science Fiction, plus autographed cards, "puzzle" cards, and chase cards were randomly thrown in for good measure. The artwork is done entirely by Edward Beard Jr., so visually the cards were wonderful. It consisted of very basic gameplay as the rules could be summed up in just a few paragraphs. It didn't amount to much more than rolling a die, adding the die roll to the value of the card in battle and thus determining the winner. Game enhancement cards could be used to sway the battle, but only a few were included in the base set. A few promo enhancement cards could be found in game related magazines of the time. Not much in the way of a game. It was worth collecting, however, just to get a set of the cards for the art alone.
23328.name: Flights of Fantasy

23329.description:
Players try to build the best buildings and take over the city.

Game contains a wooden board and 44 wooden playing pieces.
23329.name: Skybridge

boardgamehonor.9187: 1995 Årets Spil Best Children's Game Winner

23330.description:
Early in the morning, before the sun comes up, Farmer Sunshine goes out on the farm to feed all the animals. But he can't find them! He can't find Casey the cow, Emily the Lamb, Karen the donkey, or Paul the pig. Suddenly Farmer Sunshine hears Chris the dog barking. Following the sound, he finds all of the animals in the pasture. Oh boy, it looks like it's going to be a busy day! Can you help Farmer Sunshine round up all of the animals before the sun goes down?

Farm Friends is a game for young children, and families, that features a colored die for movement. The farmer's tractor is moved around the board as players collect the various animals that have escaped. Players must also collect fence pieces to build pens to house their animals.

Box contents: 1 Game board, 1 Wooden Sun token, 1 Plastic Tractor, 1 Wooden Die, 4 Farm Scenes, 16 Fence Pieces, 16 Cardboard, Animals, 16 Plastic Stands

Awards

1995 Årets Børnespil, Childrens Game of the Year Denmark
23330.name: Farm Friends

23331.name: Torpedo
23331.description:
Torpedo is a game for the Icehouse pyramid system based on the Cheapass game Light Speed. In Torpedo, players place pyramids on the table in real time, representing either a large, medium or small spaceship. After all of a player's pyramids have been placed, combat is resolved. A laser level can be used to resolve line-of-sight questions.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Winner in 4th Competition

23332.name: Tek-No-Krazy
23332.description:
TEK-NO-KRAZY Board Game by Reilly & Lee Co.

Vintage 1950's game made by Reilly and Lee co. Small box game that includes 36 metal pegs, playing board, and directions.

An elusive fascinating game for everyone 9-90

23333.description:
From the box:

"Puppy, Kitty, Bunny, and Turtle are itching to get out and do some exploring. But they can't dally too long. These little pets have to get back before anyone discovers they're missing."

"Travel around the town and visit the sites, but hurry! If you're the first Littlest Pet to visit the four locations and get back to start, you WIN! Let's give a round of a-paws."

Game includes:
4 Littlest Pet Shop Pet Pawns
Gameboard
16 tokens
Spinner
Instructions

This game is different from the 1993 "Littlest Pet Shop" game.
23333.name: Littlest Pet Shop Game

boardgamehonor.12426: 2008 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee

23334.description: From Publisher: Create a doodle with a few rolls of the Doodle Dice. There's a different doodle pictured on each card in the deck. When you build a doodle that matches one of the cards, you take that card. Block an opponent's turn or take one of their cards away. Collect one card of each color and you win! It's the fun, challenging way for everyone in your family to be a doodle artist!
23334.name: Doodle Dice

23335.name: Operation Rescue
23335.description:
From the box cover: "Fascinating adventure on land, sea and air... finding the astronaut in the vast recovery area."

Race to the Recovery Area at the center of the game board to be the first to reach the space capsule in splashdown. The game includes a little silver Gemini space capsule.

23336.name: Pyöräytä vastaus
23336.description: A game for couples. Pairs take a card that has a theme for a conversation or a mission. The pair has to reach an unanimous conclusion in the conversation or accomplish the mission. The most harmoniously acting couple wins the game.

23337.name: Kävikö flaksi?
23337.description:
"Did You Score?"

The restaurant is divided in five sections: Restaurant, Dance floor, Bar, Cloakroom and Taxi queue, each one of which has three spaces. At the start of each turn, a player must first spin the three-segment wheel of fortune (Men, Women, Unisex) and, depending on the player's real gender, take a turn or pass. When taking a turn a player moves her piece one space, then draws a card from the appropriate deck. Some of the cards have immediate effects, with others the players must roll the "smiley die" to determine whether the action taken/incident has a positive result or not.

The first player to get through the restaurant succesfully is considered to "have scored", and wins the game. In the last two decks it's also possible to "score" immediately through a card result.

The game is entirely luck based, and other players' game cannot be affected in any way.

23338.name: Chemaction
23338.description: Chemaction is a game of chemical compounds. Scrabble-like tiles have elements on them along with the number of bonds that element may form. Players hold seven tiles and draw back to seven at the end of their turn. Players must play compounds from their hand to the board, building off of an already placed element. Basically, it's Scrabble but laying chemical compounds instead of words. The board is a plain square grid, without any bonus squares. Blank tiles are also included and can represent any element. There's a bonus for using all your tiles in one turn. (The game was published by Borg-Warner Chemicals, so there's also a bonus for playing any of their phosphate compounds.)

23339.description:
from Panzerschreck Magazine #15 Minden Games with permission from Gary Graber.

North Sea Campaign is a strategic level World War I naval mini-sim for two players, where Britain's Grand Fleet squares off versus Germany's High Seas Fleet for control of the North Sea. Includes 8.5" x 11" full-color cardstock map, rules (including solitaire options), dozens of individual rectangle ship counters (dreadnought, battlecruisers, and pre-dreadnoughts) printed in full-color on cardstock, which must be cut out prior to play. The entire campaign plays out in UNDER an hour... and includes optional tactical battle rules for those of you who like a little more detail.
23339.name: North Sea Campaign

23340.description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #15 with permission from Gary Graber

Raid on Schweinfurt is a solitaire game depicting the USAAF raids in 1943 against the Schweinfurt ball-bearing factories in central Germany. The player controls the planning and execution of each massive B-17 raid, assigning target, fighter coverage, number of waves, any "diversionary" raid, and so on. It includes a "role play" option enabling you to play as though you are one of the crew members of a participating Flying Fortress, thus adding a layer of excitement to play. Fly over Germany with up to 400 bombers in a game that plays in much less than an hour! Contains 60 double-sided die-cut counters, 8.5" x 11" full-color cardstock map containing all game tables, and rules.
23340.name: Raid On Schweinfurt

23341.description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #15 with permission from Gary Graber

MORTAIN 1944 is a two-player game simulating the (limited) German Panzer offensive versus the Americans in France, August, 1944. It uses a variation of the Assault on Cherbourg system (from issue #13), and is a "conventional hex wargame" of the battle in the bocage, using daily turns. It contains 80 double-sided, die-cut counters, 8.5" x 11" full-color cardstock map, and full rules, including many options.
23341.name: Mortain 1944

23342.description:
HIPPODROME is a multi-player (works best with 3 to 5 players) "Euro style" mini-sim card game of Roman chariot racing. The emphasis here is on strategy, not on becoming a demolition derby! Includes the biggest map ever published in Panzerschreck (11" x 25") in two parts, rules, with game markers and chariots on cardstock in full-color, which must be cut out prior to play, and you'll need to provide a standard deck of cards. (Yes, there are still whip attacks and ramming!)

Published in Panzerschreck #15.
23342.name: Hippodrome

23343.description:
From Panzerschreck Magazine #3 (Fall 1999).

Barbarossa Campaign (solitaire, strategic level WW2 east front).

Components: 8.5" x 11" map, 186 counters, Economic Display, Reference Sheet, Initiative Index Track, Time Record sheet, 30 Event cards, 51 Economic chits, rules.

Description: The player (Axis) launches "Operation Barbarossa" in this strategic level game (quarterly turns, army sized units) that emphasizes economics. The game covers 1941-45.
23343.name: The Barbarossa Campaign

23344.description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #3

(Fall 1999) Cold Harbor (solitaire tactical American Civil War). Small map, 66 counters, rules. Description: The player (Union) makes a frontal assault against Confederate positions in the hope of achieving a breakthrough.
23344.name: Cold Harbor

23345.description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #6 (Summer 2001)

Jellicoe vs Scheer (two-player tactical WWI naval). Components: 100 2.5" x 5/8" individual ship counters, Reference Card, rules. Description: Expansion of the Dogger Bank game system to include all British vs German naval engagements in the North Sea during World War I. Eight scenarios, including Jutland.
23345.name: Jellicoe vs Scheer

23346.description:
The first cardgame from award winning designer Hans van Tol (De Ontembare Stad). '10' Is a hilarious cardgame, where bidding and bluffing have an important role. The artwork is by Yvon-Cheryl Scholten and has a 'retro' look.

'10' was published in May 2006.

23347.description:
A game for four players whose scope is that to make to complete to all the own pawns a complete turn of the track using the cards in order to move them.

Component:
A board
12 plastic pawns (Kings, Queens and Knights)
A deck of 42 cards
Rules
23347.name: King Card

boardgamehonor.19972: 2008 Games Magazine Best New Abstract Strategy Game Winner

23348.description:
Easter Island is a mysterious island in the South Pacific. Its inhabitants have long since vanished without a trace except for the giant Moai. These giant statues are so large and heavy that modern man has had a difficult time recreating them without modern tools. Tools the original inhabitants most certainly couldn't possess.

This game speculates that the statues were, in fact, beam weapons created by two very powerful wizards. These wizards used the statues in a giant game, with the island itself as the board. You are now one of those wizards...

Easter Island lets you place your statues and move them into position. Then, when everything is ready, call upon the power of the Sun to topple your opponent's statues and thus your opponent.
23348.name: Easter Island

23349.name: Grands Stratèges
23349.description: This ones´s a game to learn "strategic components". It isn't based on an historic conflict, but you can learn about moving and acting in different scenarios with Infantry, Artillery and Cavalry units from the 18th/19th century

23350.name: Plan Barbarossa
23350.description:
(translation from back of the box:)

PLAN BARABAROSSA is a wargame for 2 players which recreates, during game plays which can last 2 hours and more, the invasion of USSR by Wehrmacht [German] forces in 1941. For confirmed beginners, it is an excellent introduction to World war Two strategical wargames.


(extract from rule book:)

Each turn represents one month or two (winter turns only); total of 8 turns (July 1941 to April 1942).

23351.name: Feinschmecker
23351.description: Feinschmecker is a Trivia game about designers, fashion, luxury etc. If you are familiar with all these: Dom Perignon, Riva, Ducati, Rolex, Louis Vuitton, Cartier, Fabergé, Latife Rotschild, Portofino, GQ, Napoéon, Golf, Concorde, Wall-street, Hermés, St. Tropez, Villa D'Este, Tom Wolfe, Lamborghini, Swan, Marc Newson, The Metropolitan, Beluga, Aston Martin, Jaeger Le Coultre, Guggenheim, Phillippe Starck and Arne Jacobsen, this is a trivia game for you.

23352.name: Pomarańczowa Rewolucja
23352.description: "Pomarañczowa rewolucja" (Orange revolution) is the first attempt to portray the events that took place in Ukraine in November and December 2004, and possible alternate ways the conflict could have developed. The players can take the roles of supporters of the "orange" opposition of Wiktor Juschtschenko, or "the blues" - government side of Wiktor Janukowytsch. In a 4 player game each player plays one of the 2 orange or blue factions, with players forming 2 teams.

23353.name: Abenteuer Reiterhof
23353.description: Players 'ride' on a course and have to answer questions about horses from five categories. These include e.g. how to care for a horse, feed and medicine, breeding, etc. For players 10 years and older.

23354.name: Chicken Pickin'
23354.description:
A dexterity game for two players age 7 and above.

Each player takes a pair of chopsticks. The players agree how many rounds they wish to play. One player takes the 10 chickens and three dice and throws them on the table. The sum of the two red dice, minus the number rolled on the blue die, is the target number. If the target number is greater than 0, the players grab the chopsticks and try to pick up as many chickens as the target number demands. The player who manages to do this first, scores that number. If the target number is less than 1, grabbing the chopsticks gives the player 1 negative point. The next round starts with the player who lost this round throwing dice and chickens.

Components: 10 grilled chickens, 2 pairs of chopsticks, 2 red dice, 1 blue die

23355.description:
A simple game of ammonite racing. A die is rolled to determine how far the pieces move, but which ones move is determined by a played card, and the order they are moved in is up to the player.

This description applies to the second edition published in 1993. The first edition (from 1986) apparently did not use the cards.
23355.name: Ammoniten-Rennen

23357.name: Pick Out Stix
23357.description:
"Grab a color...but don't touch the sides!"

This is a simple electronic dexterity game for all ages.
Twenty-eight plastic, chrome-plated rods are placed in holes through a conductive play field. The holes are about a quarter-inch wider than the diameter of the rods, and there are holes under the holes to keep the rods centered and vertical. A handle with conductive, spring-loaded, plier-like pincher is wired to the base unit. When the circuit is completed between the play field and the pincers, a loudish explosion sound goes off and a small light goes on. The top of the rods are slightly flattened and have a piece of tape on the flat sides.

The game consists of rolling a big die marked with the three colors, and then using the pliers to pull out a rod of that color without touching the edge of the play field hole, ala Operation. The instructions instruct players to grab the rods by the edges (non-taped) of the flattened top, I suppose to ensure a solid contact between the rod and pincher.

It's not that easy. You have to watch carefully that you're pulling the rods out exactly vertical, and there's little "feel" using the pliers to judge the force you're using. The circuit is very sensitive and doesn't let you get away with much. The explosion sound was surprisingly loud the first time I tried the game, not at all like the Operation buzzer - startled the crap out of me. Same thing apparently happened to the kid pictured on the box...

23358.name: Moon Blast Off
23358.description:
"The winners blast off for Earth below, the loser doesn't get to go."

The game consists of a circular molded plastic gameboard about 12" diameter which resembles the lunar surface and is raised on 'legs'. There are four craters in the surface, one for each player. The center is dominated by a plastic rocket which locks into the gameboard mechanism, effectively creating a platform beneath each crater.

Each player starts with the full complement of five plastic astronauts of their selected color. Players place one of their astronauts on the platform in the nearest crater.

A marble is spun around the rim of the circular gameboard; when it loses velocity it drops into one of a series of colored depressions which circle the board just inside the marble track. The player controlling the astronauts corresponding to the colored depression that the marble stops in must quickly grab the central rocket & remove it from the board. This causes the platforms beneath the craters to move aside and the astronauts to fall through the board. Players must attempt to catch their astronauts before they fall.

Any astronauts that fall through the board are given to the player who removed the rocket. The winner is the first player to get ten astronauts.

Interesting game in that four (and only four) players are required.

23359.name: Old Macdonald Counting Snap
23359.description:
Actually there are rules for 3 games on the box which contains 48 cards, 4 each of 12 different pictures ranging numerically from 1 tractor to 12 mice.
You can play a simple memory matching game or a game of SNAP, which is basically flipping face down cards over until there are matches.
Ages 3-6 on the box.

23360.name: Cosmic Decoders

3033.name: Family Astro: Astronomical Society of the Pacific

23360.description:
From the publisher web site:

The Cosmic Decoders Leader Kit is the fourth release in our series of family events and activities on topics in astronomy for Family ASTRO Event Leaders. It focuses on how astronomers "decode" light from space to learn about the universe and how we might decode radio waves from possible alien civilizations out there. The Cosmic Decoders Card Set (the corresponding Take-Home Activity) consists of a deck of 72 cards featuring beautiful color images of cosmic objects and some well-known telescopes. These can be used to play four different fun astronomical games.

23361.description:
Played on a 6X6 square board BS Chess uses similar pieces and movement patterns to chess. however the identity of a piece is only know to it's controller. This allows players make normally illegal moves. Like a knight's leap with a pawn or a pawn's capture with a knight. After each move the opposing player may or may not call BS (short for bluffing style) in that case the moving piece is revealed, and a penalty is given to moving player if they cheated or to the calling player if the move was legal.

One other big change to chess is that the players pieces start in stacks along the back row of the board. This allows for a bit of meta gaming and reduces the number of choices each round even though a standard 16 man chess army is used.
23361.name: BS Chess (Bluffing Style Chess)

23362.name: Fortunet: A Game of Ultra-Net Wealth
23362.description:
From the side of the box:

Find excitement and intrigue in the fast paced world of high finance and investments! See which player can attain the greatest wealth by making the wisest investment decisions in a complex and risky financial marketplace.

Start out with borrowed funds and invest your money to earn millions; act as a consultant as a strategy to achieve more wealth. Develop your own strategies and become financial guru extraordinaire!!!!!

For Adults of all ages.

2-4 individuals or 2-4 teams.

Game includes: Gameboard . 4 colored playing pieces (gurus) . 4 portfolio trays . question/answer cards . money . 1 die. Box is approx 9 1/4" X 9 1/4" x 3 1/4".

(c) R. M. Samuels P.O.Box 2686, Station B, Richmond Hill, Ontario L4E 1A7. TM Fortunet is a registered Trademark of R. M. Samuels.

Printed in Canada

23363.name: Ord Geni
23363.description: Guess the word using as few letters as possible. The less you use the farther your playing piece may move. Throw the dice and let them show which combination of lids you may open, thus revealing letters. The one who reach the finishing line first wins the game.

23364.name: Pounce
23364.description:
Pounce - A Fast Moving Battle of Words and Wits!

Contents: 56 letter cards and a tray that holds a row of 4 cards.

After an initial 4-letter word is placed in the tray, players play simultaneously. Place letter cards (one card at a time) on the tray, covering an existing letter and making a new word. First player to run out of cards wins.

23366.name: Net Y
23366.description:
Net Y is an acronym for Nested Tetrahedrons Y. There are three superimposed, interdependent instances of Y which are played simultaneously. Two of the grids are imprinted on tetrahedral shapes, and one is imprinted on a simple triangle. The winner of the majority of the three wins overall.

Net Y rule sheet:
http://www.marksteeregames.com/Net_Y_rules.pdf

Net Y printable game board:
http://www.marksteeregames.com/Net_Y_board.pdf

23367.name: Jonathan
23367.description:
A route-puzzle game with a basic rules and advanced one. In basic game wins the player who catches up for first the Pyramid, finding the faster distance that joins the card of departure to the same Pyramid.
In the advanced game the player wins who accumulates more adventure points during the crossing of the jungle in order to arrive to the Pyramid.

23368.name: Aristo
23368.description:
From the back of the game box:
Contents: Original plastic playing board plus 64 two sided (yellow and green) playing pieces, plus game instructions.

Aristo - The Game

The AIM - to try to end the game with a majority of your color pieces on the board. Aristo is a game of wits. You have to outwit your opponent, overturn as many of his pieces as possible in each turn and aim to cover the playing board with your color.
Sounds simple? The problem is that your opponent is trying to do exactly the same to you!!! Are your pieces blocked? Are most of the pieces on the board your opponent's color? Don't give up... one well placed piece can turn your opponent's pieces over to your color in up to eight different directions at once!!!

23369.name: DEMOCRACity
23369.description: Democracity is an educational game. By establishing a political party and creating a city, players learn how politics work. As a group they work together at a political project. They experience that debate, majority and consensus are needed in a democratic society and that all votes count.

23370.name: X is for uneXplained
23370.description: Answer questions on UFO sightings, Psychic phenomena, Out of body experiences or Alien abduction. Be the first to collect cards from all the different categories and return to Earth to win. A different take on the Trivial Pursuit theme for all those who believe the truth really is out there.

23371.description: The Listen and Match Sing-a-Long game for children 2 years old and up. Designed to develop the child's listening, concentration and matching skills.
23371.name: Old MacDonald Soundtracks

23373.description:
From the Website:

Do you have what it takes to rule the Galaxy?

Engage your Hero in the battle for galactic domination! Be the first to explore space, develop technology, and control planets and you will become the Ruler of the Galaxy.

Galaxy is a two player HeroCard game that can be expanded to a three or four player game with additional decks.

Expanded by:

HeroCard Galaxy Crab Expansion Deck
HeroCard Galaxy EGG Expansion Deck
23373.name: HeroCard Galaxy

24807.name: Herocard Champion of New Olympia Ferrion Expansion Deck

23374.description:
From the Website:

The Mayor of New Olympia has just sent out an urgent message to heroes around the globe:

“New Olympia is in dire straits! Villainous gangs wreaking havoc on the citizens! Robotic Invaders destroying the fair city! We need a Hero to discover their plots, foil their plans, and restore order! Be the first and you will be awarded the title- "Champion of New Olympia"!”

Champion of New Olympia is a two player HeroCard game that can be expanded to a three or four player game with additional decks.

Expanded by:

Herocard Champion of New Olympia Ferrion Expansion Deck
HeroCard Champion of New Olympia Talon Expansion Deck
23374.name: HeroCard Champion of New Olympia

26005.name: HeroCard Rise of the Shogun Miko Expansion Deck

23375.description:
From the website:

It is the late 12th century. The sun has set on the classical period of Japan. The emperor’s power has waned and a new power is growing on the horizon. Now, through alliances, court manipulation, and hand to hand combat, competing factions will battle in an epic struggle for control of feudal Japan.

Rise of the Shogun is a two player HeroCard game that can be expanded to a three or four player game with additional decks.

Expanded by:

HeroCard Rise of the Shogun Miko Expansion Deck
HeroCard Rise of the Shogun Prince Expansion Deck
23375.name: HeroCard Rise of the Shogun

23376.name: India's Epic Mahabharata Game
23376.description:
India’s Epic Mahabharata Game is a track game based on the most magnificent epic of Indian mythology. Players gain support from one of the two warring families, either the Pandava or Kaurava. To win, players must obtain 1 Celestial Weapon card, 1 Flag or Conch card, 8 Virtue Cards and 18 Coins.

Players roll 2d6 to move around the board, each square of which is an event. Warrior squares grant the support of individual warriors (such as Arjuna or Karna), or require a Joust (if the warrior square denotes someone who is in the same family as those that support the player) or a Fight (if from the other family). Karma squares confer a card with random events, such as “you grab 2 Coins from each player!” or “Give up 2 coins to receive 2 Virtue Cards.” Prowess squares give cards that confer either Virtue cards (needed to win) or Wrath cards (which cause a Virtue discard) to the various warriors. Many squares are a people (Krishna, Queen Kunti, etc.) or places (Indraprastha, Abode of Yama, etc.) that confer a random event, often a Blessing or Coins. Subtracks allow special 1d6 movement through Exile or Trial where players can obtain the key winning elements of Celestial Weapons and Flags/Conches.

The cards and board both relate some of the many events from the epic. The designer is a noted educator, and this was clearly intended to be an educational game.

23377.name: Table Badminton
23377.description: This is a dexterity game where players try to hit the shuttlecocks into their opponent's territory to score points.

boardgamehonor.10955: 2006 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine-Published Boardgame Nominee

23378.description:
The Cold War Battles game system is a grand tactical simulation of battles that were fought—or could have been fought—during the Cold War. The playing pieces represent the actual units that participated or could have participated.

Two games included in this issue are: BUDAPEST 1956, covering the ill-fated rebellion in the Hungarian capital in late 1956; and BLITZKRIEG ANGOLA, the clashes between Cuban and South African mechanized forces in Angola in 1987 and 1988.

There are two players in each game. In BUDAPEST 1956 one player controls the Hungarian Rebels and possible NATO "what-if" reinforcements, the other controls the forces of the Warsaw Pact. In BLITZKRIEG ANGOLA one player controls the South Africans and their UNITA allies, the other the Cuban and MPLA forces.

In the Budapest game each hexagon on the map represents half a kilometer across, and each game turn represents one day. Soviet maneuver units are mostly battalions, with regiments for their artillery and assault guns; Hungarian rebel units are ad hoc groups; and NATO intervention, when playing that special alternative history scenario, are represented by US "Pentomic" battlegroups.

In the Angola game each hexagon on the map represents eight kilometers across, while each turn represents anywhere from one week of intensive combat to four weeks of refitting. Units on both sides are mainly battalions or equivalent groups of irregulars.

The game system is low-complexity (totaling about 13,000 words) and compares to the one used in last year's Middle East Battles: Suez '56 & El Arish '67. There are 280 NATO-style (with some iconic) half-inch counters. Playing time between two experienced opponents of roughly equal skill levels will be about three hours per game. Designed by Joseph Miranda.

Cold War Battles: Budapest '56 & Angola '87 was published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #235.
23378.name: Cold War Battles: Budapest '56 & Angola '87

23379.name: Original Sudoku Card Game
23379.description:
Just like Sudoku game, the original one.
But the numbers are presented by playing card forms.

23380.name: Holiday Charades!
23380.description: Charades redone with a holiday theme. Consists of 60+ cards with the name of a holiday classic: movies, books, songs, and characters. As in the classic game, upon drawing a card, it is up to the players to act out the Charades for teammates. Tips and hints included on some cards.

23381.name: Warlords & Wizards
23381.description: The most challenging board game created since the ancient game of chess. Imagine controlling two armies of magical creatures with specific movement patterns into battle. Enter your most powerful piece, the Wizard, from off the battlefield to create havoc for your opponent. Use your Dragon Slayer and Priestess in mystical movements to bewilder your challenger. Confuse your opponent by disguising your true intentions, followed with an ambush from your Warlord; Combine your sorceress, Elf, and Fortress to finish off your rival in one breathtaking conclusion!

23382.name: GummiHamster 40K
23382.description:
Appeared in Dork Tower: The Junkfood Issue (#19 June/July 2002).

Miniatures rules for Gummi Bear warfare.

You need:
-- 10 Gummi Bears for each player's army (each player has Gummi Bears of a distinct color)
-- a dollar bill for measuring movement distance and attack zone
--a set of 'Fate Bears' for each player (one bear of each of the five main colors) for combat resolution.
--Play area with obstacles

On your turn, you may move (some or all of your Gummis) and the attack. Combat is resolved by the attacker secretly choosing a Fate Bear and the defender secretly choosing one or more (depending on the situation) Fate Bears. If the attacker's Fate Bear does not match any of the defender's Fate Bear colors, the attack is successful.

Comes with 4 scenarios (variants).

23383.name: Hokm
23383.description:
Hokm is an old trick-taking card game from Iran usually played with four players in fixed partnerships; however there are 2 and 3-player variants. It is part of the Whist family of card games and similar to spades, but there is no bidding, and trump is declared every hand.

The object of Hokm is to be the first team or player to win 7 points. It's the most popular card game in Iran. Deal and play are anticlockwise.

The word Hokm literally means "command, order" but in card game jargon, it's Persian for trump suit.

Hâkem
At the beginning of each hand, one of the players becomes Hâkem. Hâkem literally means "ruler, governor" and in card game jargon, it refers to a player having certain privileges in the game. In Hokm, these privileges are:

- To be the player who receives the first cards dealt.
- To be the player who makes trump (i.e. chooses and declares what suit will be trump) for the current hand.
- To be the player who leads to the first trick of the hand.

Players and Cards
Hokm can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. If with four players, two players normally team up against the other two.

The game uses a standard 52-card deck. Within each suit, the cards are ranked from highest to lowest: A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2

23384.name: Math Magic
23384.description: This unique game encourages children to learn how to add and subtract in a fun way. The player matches a problem card with an answer card and then turns them over. If the match-up is correct, a complete animal picture is formed on the other side.

23385.name: The Welfare Game & A Modest Solution
23385.description:
A St. Croix's Socio/Economic Game Kit

The sensational game that shows how to stop spiraling welfare costs: stimulate the economy: bring creativity back to the bureaucracy and make money for it's players!

23386.name: The People's Choice
23386.description: Four parties (Democrat, Green, Libertarian, and Republican) compete for ten US Senate seats. The catch: they don't know until the end game which method (plurality, instant runoff, approval, Borda count, or Condorcet) will be used to count the ballots! Special cards cover fund raisers, gerrymandering, apathy, scandals, and ballot tampering.

23387.description:
Collectible Card Game based on Conan.
Artwork and ideas pulled mainly from Robert E. Howard's works with other sources to follow in expansions.

The goal is to become King of Aquilonia. Your version of Conan (each player will have one of their own) needs to gain renown by defeating enemies. These foes come in varying strengths and attempt to flank your Conan card to inflict as many hits as possible. If your Conan falls to 0 health, you lose. The choice lies in heaving many weak foes at Conan, or 1 or 2 major enemies.

The combat mechanic involves the comparison of icons along the sides of the moves and maneuvers performed by Conan and his various foes. These will determine hits, misses, and blocks.

The game features new artwork from Dark Horse artist Paul Lee, CCG artists such as Alex Horley and Patrick McEvoy, and legendary fantasy artist, Ken Kelly. Some art is taken from current Dark Horse comics, as well as some old Savage Sword covers.
23387.name: Conan Collectible Card Game

23388.name: Ninja Galaxy
23388.description:
AD 3017 - In the Ninja Galaxy it has been discovered that the four main star systems are becoming unstable. A destructive virus is spreading. The Ninja Elders have decided that only one star system can be saved. The other ones must be quickly neutralized. Which ones? To decide, the four Ninja Clans will battle each other at the Galaxy Power Rings. The winner's star system will be saved.

Advance RING-LEVELS by going through PORTALS. Sabotage your opponents with PORTAL-BLOCKERS, and VAPORIZE blockers in your way. Battle your opponents up close with LASER SWORDS, or eliminate them with LIGHT STARS. Finally, NEUTRALIZE the other star systems with the very powerful NEGATIVE ENERGY DISCS (NED).

New Advanced Rules: Use your Ninja Master Card to come into the battle when your ninja is facing elimination. In addition, each ninja has a special ability and on the third hit-point is eliminated. This adds much more strategy to the game and plays in about an hour.

Ninja Galaxy is a fun Space-Battle Adventure for the whole family and yet serious enough for the "gamer." A game of strategy, chance and fantastic finishes!

23389.name: Les Cabanes de M'sieur Robinson
23389.description:
Robinson is lazy! He just landed on yhis island and he prefers to work on his tan instead of doing what any good shipwrecked man would do: build a hut to shelter him! Luckily, a few tricky monkeys have decided to help him build a comfortable shack. It won't be an easy task and they compete hardly!

Players participate in the building of 3 huts amongst which Robinson will choose his crib. He wants it BIG, TALL, FULL of amenities, and with lots of monkeys! In short the guy is pretty demanding...

23390.name: Bible Action Heroes Matching Game
23390.description: Match the Bible Hero with their Biblical action he or she performed. Suitable for ages 4 & up.

23391.name: Take Five: The Phase 10 Board Game
23391.description:
The gameboard is a 10x10 grid, numbered from 1-12 in four different colors (brown, orange, red, and green). The center four squares are marked "Skip." A deck of PHASE 10 cards and plastic chips in three colors are also provided.

Players play cards that allow them to place a chip on a square that matches the card's color/number combination. Players attempt in this way to place five of their chips in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row. "Skip" cards allow the player to place a chip on one of the matching center squares, and cause the following player to miss the next turn. Wild cards are also included.

23392.name: Chinchirorin
23392.description:
Chinchirorin is a traditional Japanese dice game for 2 or more players. Derived from the Chinese game Sz'ng Luk, it is also known by other names, including See-Low, One-Two-Three, and Strung Flowers, just to name a few.

Chinchirorin gained a small degree of renown abroad after its inclusion as a 'mini-game' in several installations of the popular Playstation video game series 'Genso Suikoden' by Konami. The only components required are 3standard six-sided dice and a small bowl in which to roll them.

Players take turns making wagers, then rolling the dice to try to outscore each other. Very lucky rolls, called 'storms', can even multiply the wagers several fold. A common analogy compares Chinchirorin to an oriental version of 'craps'.

23393.name: Robotech CCG
23393.description:
Hero Factory released this collectible card game in the summer of 2006 based on the popular Robotech television series. The game simulates battles between opposing factions, and features all the characters and mechas from the anime. Though not 'collectible' in a traditional sense (all of the cards are the same rarity, sold in pre-constructed 'theme' decks), the game is still fully customizable, with over 250 unique cards planned in the full set for deck construction.

There are 5 different decks currently available, each containing 50 cards with a fixed composition (no randomly inserted cards):

Robotech CCG Starter deck
Azonia' Forces Deck
Blue Squadron Deck
Breetai's Forces Deck
The SDF-1 Deck

Hero Factory also plans to release two additional decks, the 'Robotech Masters 2-Player Starter' and the 'New Generation 2-Player Starter', early in 2007, but further details beyond that point have not been disclosed.

23394.name: Het Elfstedenspel
23394.description:
This is a game about the Elfstedentocht (Eleven Cities Tour), a 200-km ice skating race that leads through eleven different cities.

Each player tries to win the race by being the first to reach the finish. Every turn, a player rolls a die and moves his pawn (a skater) as many spaces forward as the die indicates.

Depending on the field where he ends, several follow-up actions are possible, such as having to move back some spaces (due to adverse wind) or taking another turn (because the public cheers you on). On certain fields, the player must answer a trivia question on the Elfstedentocht. The questions are about the race itself and about the eleven cities.

23395.name: Word$tock
23395.description:
From the box:

Word$tock -- the unique definitional word game of skill, strategy, and chance --- is designed to increase vocabulary, build word power, and enhance verbal expressive ability in children and adults by utilizing selected word categories and graduated vocabulary levels.

Game Format: Four thousand words at five graduated levels of difficulty, from eight interesting word categories are required to be defined according to one of five versions or variations of Word$tock: Family, Cut-Throat, Cooperative, Solitaire, and Boardless.

Game Objectives: (1) To define correctly words of varying difficulty in specified word categories; (2) to increase knowledge of words and their usage; (3) to stimulate interest in language and learning in general; and (4) to experience FUN in a learning situation.

23396.name: Quinna
23396.description:
Quinna was developed by NBV (Nykterhetsrörelsens bildningsverksamhet/ The Educational activity of the Sobriety movement) to be part in a study circle about womens situation across the world.

You and those you play each with choose a women and then roll dice to either answer questions about Womens Rights and situations or about the situation for the women you choice to play. When you answer correctly you get a tile to a puzzle that will end up showing the womens face. First one to get the full face wins. You might also both lose and get bonus tiles when you use the dice.

23397.name: City Dogs
23397.description: A children's game where you move around the board trying to collect four cards. Looks to be a fairly simple game suitable for younger children.

23398.name: Quest for Clients
23398.description: Quest for Clients is developed and produced by Identity Games for Capgemini. It is a Monopoly-like game, where each 'street' is a client, and the players are competing consultants, who try to win the game by offering more service to clients, and trying to keep other consultants away from clients.

23399.name: Sammakot satimessa
23399.description: Sammakot satimessa is Finnish for something like "Frogs in the Trap." The idea of this game is to get four frogs that share a trait on the same line (orthogonally or diagonally) to score a point. It's a bit like Tic-tac-toe on a 4x4-grid. There's a possibility for double points if your frogs share two traits. It's also possible that more than one winning line is formed at same time. 5 points to win game.

boardgamehonor.21311: 2006 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Nominee

23400.description:
Napoleon at the Crossroads - The Highways to Leipzig 14 August - 25 October 1813

Campaigns of Napoleon System "2X." Very similar to the "1X" Series, 6 km (3.75 miles) per hex, 3 days per turn, 3,000 men per strength point.

The full Autumn campaign lasts just 24 turns. Scenarios cover the decisive start of the campaign in August 1813, the Crossing of the Elbe at Wartenburg in mid Sept, and the approach to Leipzig starting on October 8th.

COMPONENTS: one 22 x 34" map; 56 pages of rules including campaign analysis, designers notes and more; 10 player aid cards (Organization Displays, Leader & Unit Manifests, March Set-up Tables that allow set-up on various dates); one box.

GAME SYSTEM: CAMPAIGNS System - Series 2X = 6,000m/hex, 3,000 men/SP, 3 days/turn.
23400.name: Napoleon at the Crossroads

boardgameaccessory.144297: Napoleon at the Crossroads Game Box

23401.name: Scoop 'em Up
23401.description: Players compete to assemble ice cream cones from hands of colorful scoop-shaped cards, each depicting one of five ice cream flavors. Includes rules for four different game variants (two resemble war, two are rummy-like).

23402.name: Die unendliche Geschichte
23402.description:
In Unendliche Geschichte, you set out on an adventurous quest to search the world of the "Never Ending Story" to find the "Key of Joy". Each player represents one of the four elements. When your comes around, you get to be a hero.

Most of the game sets you out on solo adventures, but the cards you use make things difficult to do without the help of others. Follow the adventures on the cards (based on where you are on the map) to collect Signposts. When you get three Signposts you can jump to where you need to go (to collect Crystals and Landscapes).

Each player is constrained by their die roll to see what abilities they can use such as intelligence, creativity, skill, throwing, courage and strength, but you may make choices based on what you are given.

23403.name: Marines versus Zombies
23403.description:
From the item's listing:
"Trapped in a crumbling city, surrounded by brain eating zombies... Can the gallant marines make it to the helipad for evac before they become lunch?" Marines versus Zombies is an exciting game for two or more players. A group of marines has been cut off from base and must struggle to find the helipad and escape. The map is constructed from 25 face-down tiles, randomly laid out in a 5x5 grid which allows for a unique game every time.

Marines vs. Zombies is a 46 page book with everything you need to run complete games.

23404.name: Les morts aux trousses
23404.description: You (and your friends) are surrounded by an army of zombies. Uncle Sal's house is not far away, and he has a bunker that was built in the cellar during the nuclear war paranoia of the 50's. The key to the bunker is somewhere in this 3-level house... and the bunker is small... very small ! In fact, just a single person can be supported by the bunker facilities ! You will be the supported one ... or the eaten one? !

23406.name: Kang Le Qi
23406.description:
This is a traditional Chinese variant of Snakes and Ladders. Like Snakes and Ladders, it takes place on a square board with a boustrouphedron track, and players roll a die to move their piece from start to finish. The distinguishing features of this distinct subgenre are that the board is set in a playground with many children playing on a see-saw, a slide, a Ferris wheel, a merry-go-round, and so on. Some squares will have instructions that will move the player forward, backward or cause a missed turn.

Like other traditional Chinese games of this ilk, it is made by different companies and comes in small boxes with a folded paper board - in this case, the board is often fairly colourful. More modern versions include cartoon character themes (e.g. Doraemon Kang Le Qi, Snoopy Kang Le Qi).

23407.name: 18SX
23407.description: 18SX is an 18xx game and is a reworking of 1837 SX by the same author. It is available German as well as in English either as kit or as RTP. The game has 13 corporations, up to 10 of which may be in play, with 'concessions' to determine who may start which companies distributed in a start-packet system. The game has a unique track system where directors have to choose between single and double track which will also have an effect on route length.

23408.description:
18EC is a new 18xx gamekit published by Wolfram Janich in 2005. Available in kit and ready-to-play form, in both English and German, the game is set between the east coast of the USA and the Mississippi. The game has a larger-than-usual bank and a very large map, leading to a long game, even for 18xx titles.

May be purchased directly from the designer in kit form or ready to play.
23408.name: 18EC: USA East Coast

23409.name: Monopoly: Bank Elhaz Elsaed
23409.description: An Egyptian Monopoly version, where the 27 properties are countries; grouped in 2, 3 or 4. The countries: Sudan, Lebanon, Jordan, Syria, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Egypt, Sudan (again), Yemen, UAE, Oman, Libya, Tunisia, Algeria, Morocco, Mauritania, Qatar, France, Italy, England, Germany, USA, Russia / USSR, Japan, Spain, Canada. Money are shares of 1 - 5 - 10 - 20 - 50 - 100 500 - 1000 - 2000. You can build pink hotels, black markets and blue garages.

23410.name: Prehistoric Dogs
23410.description: Be the first player to collect 'The Cavepainter's Palette', 'The Cookout Spear', 'Fire Sticks' and 'The Big Round Turning Thing That's Fun to Chase' pieces for each player.

23411.name: Launch Across
23411.description: A fast dexterity game. Players sit across from each other. Each has a set of plastic balls (blue or yellow). The board is a Connect Four style grid with an opening at the top, and a backboard. You use a plastic catapult-like flipper to pop your balls into the grid (either simultaneously, or in turns) ... first to get four in a row wins!

23412.name: Card Dice
23412.description:
The game comprises a deck of cards that set the challenge and four 14 sided dice that mimic a deck of cards (including jokers). The start player takes a card and reads the challenge (roll 4 dice and get all hearts and diamonds; get a flush; get two pairs etc), and then all players roll the dice, and will score according to how many rolls it takes for them to achieve the challenge. The game continues like this for 14 rounds (regardless of number of players), highest score at the end is the winner.

Apparently patented worldwide, the only version of this game I have seen is an Arsenal Football Club colored edition.

23413.name: Dead Man's Dice
23413.description:
Dead Man's Dice ... avast there ye swabs, 'tis a pirates' fast 'n' fun game o' dice.

Games Above Board publishes the 2 to 6-player game ... with or without a bandana. T-shirts also available.
Channel Craft publishes a 2-player version with red and black dice.

Pirates take turns rolling (and then stacking) dice to build point-scoring piles o' treasure ... by matching like numbers, numbers in succession or sums of 7.

Plundering the opponent's dice is not only permitted but strongly advised.

Pillaging is not recommended - you have been warned!

Beware the Jolly Roger … double your points and seal victory or, if caught holding Dead Man's Dice, be keelhauled to subtract 7 points.

Sending your opponent to Davy Jones' Locker by firing a broadside is one way to sink your opponent but it will cost you in doubloons.

Played round by round - the first to score a total of 100 doubloons (points) wins.

23415.name: Macius: Rette die Tiere!
23415.description: King Macius has collected many exotic animals for his zoo. Now they are very hungry. You must help King Macius feed the animals.

23416.description: Players move along a track of 52 spaces (A a B b C c . . . Z z), and if the first to land on a square they take and keep a matching card with an image and word or phrase from the book upon which the game is based. Movement is determined by a spinner; each result can be taken either as a number (1-4), or "BIG" or "little" which advances one to the next upper- or lowercase lettered space. Game ends when the last player reaches the end, and the winner is the player who holds the most cards. Recommended for ages 3+.
23416.name: Dr. Seuss's ABC

23417.description:
This is a free print-and-play map that allows to play a variant of the game China.

The map adds two new features:
• Border towns, which allow a player to place a house into a space that counts as belonging to both adjacent regions.
• Port Towns, which act as an additional region that will be scored at the end of the game with the same house-scoring rules as other regions.

These new features add a bit more complexity, depth, and confrontation while still maintaining the simplicity of the basic game.

Expands:

China

boardgameversion.105803: Timbuktu Print and Play download version

23417.name: China: Grenzstreitigkeiten

boardgamehonor.21278: 2008 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-WW2 era Board Game Nominee

23418.description:
(from GMT website:)
Pursuit of Glory: The Great War in the Near East is a sequel to the award-winning Paths of Glory. This game puts you in the driver's seat of the British/Russian alliance or the Ottoman Empire during World War One. Gallipoli, holy war, mutiny, and the Russian Revolution await. Walk in the shoes of men such as Churchill, Lawrence of Arabia, Enver, and Falkenhayn.

The action stretches from India to the Balkans, from the Black Sea to Suez. Can the Germans inspire a Persian uprising or forge an alliance with Afghanistan? Can the Russians capture a warm water port? Can the British guard the oil that fuels the Royal Navy? Can the Turks capture the Suez Canal and spark a revolt in Egypt?

In Pursuit of Glory you will constantly feel that you're on the razor's edge - on the verge of impending doom or of breakthrough and total victory. Your hand of 7 cards presents you with a rich array of strategic and operational opportunities. You must decide whether to use each card for its historic event, command points, or resources. You must then commit your forces to a variety of objectives: the Turkish-Russian frontier in Caucasia, the violation of neutral Persia, oil-rich Mesopotamia, the Suez Canal, the Balkans and its vital railroads. You must judge when it is right to invade Serbia or launch a new naval invasion (perhaps on the inset map representing Gallipoli).

As the British, you must hold on while your Russian allies break through the Turkish lines in Caucasia and you bring your forces to bear through invasion and a gradual build-up of imperial might. As the Turks, your objective is to gain complete victory early, uniting your strength with Germany and crippling the British Empire in Egypt and India or to persevere.

If you are looking for a game that is relevant, dynamic, fun, tense, and a frantic roller coaster of a game, you will enjoy Pursuit of Glory.

Game Features
TIME SCALE Approx. 1 year per hand of cards
MAP SCALE Point-to-Point
NUMBER OF PLAYERS One or Two

COMPONENTS:
Two full color counter sheets
110 full color playing cards
One 22 x 34" full color map
Rule Booklet
Scenario Booklet
Player Aid Cards
Two 6-sided dice

DESIGNER: Brad Stock & Brian Stock
DEVELOPER: Tony Curtis & Neil Randall
MAP, CARD, & COUNTER ART: Mark Simonitch


(BGG description:)

Pursuit of Glory is a stand alone sequel to Paths of Glory, a card-driven strategy game covering the first World War. Unlike the original game, which focused on the European theater of World War I, Pursuit of Glory focuses entirely on the Great War in the Middle East. Pursuit of Glory uses the same card-driven mechanics and point-to-point of the first game, but with some rules changes and modifications to better simulate the conditions of the war in the Middle East.

It was developed by Brad and Brian Stock with the permission of Ted Raicer, the designer of the original Paths of Glory.
23418.name: Pursuit of Glory

23421.description:
Another in the 18xx series initiated by Francis Tresham's 1829, 1832 models railroad development in the southeastern United States during an era of consolidation. The rules are similar to 1850 and 1870 with the addition of two types of mergers to model the railroad consolidation.

Companies included are A&WP, ACL, CoG, FEC, GM&O, GRR, L&N, N&W, SAL, and Southern.

23422.name: Monster Dice
23422.description: Monster Dice is a game that uses extra dice from a player's collection to wage war. Each player is given a game card showing what type of dice are used in their fantasy army - and the back of other cards are used for the hex battlefields. The player who manages to keep their army alive the longest is the winner!

23423.name: Fridgeplay Golf
23423.description:
One of the more novel designs from FridgePlay, compared to the more traditional games they've adapted to playing on a metal wall surface. It is a light-weight golf game, where the players alternate building the course from a stock of fairway tiles. Actual play involves choosing a long or short stroke, and resolving distance and accuracy with a spinner.

Using hallmark FridgePlay presentation, games can be played over a long period of time by room mates who would rather not see each other but still are trustworthy enough not to cheat.

23424.name: Bambukarhut
23424.description: Bamboo bears known from TV are here. Join Bamboo-Lee, Slo-Lee and Dah-Lin for an adventure. If you're lucky you're traveling fast on the back of the dragon Ai-Ai. If you're not so lucky the Rats appear and try to slow you down. Players are traveling around the world and saving endangered species. The game teaches kids ecology and they can learn about endangered species.

23425.name: Down Styphon!
23425.description:
Down Styphon! Is a miniatures game simulating Musket and Pike warfare. The setting of the game is based on one of the stories in the Paratime series by H.Beam Piper. The main character Lord Kalvin, who is a Penn. State Trooper that ends up on a parallel earth where the 'secret' of gunpowder is controlled by a group of Priests who's influence and gunpowder or 'Fireseed' as it's called can be bought and controlled. Kalvin also possesses the knowledge of making 'Fireseed', better guns and the history of warfare.
The rule book is 20 pages with two card stock loose pages that have turn references and combat result tables. This game was designed in 1977 when all they had was 28mm minis, but you can just change the scale of movement and range without too much trouble. You can use any English Civil war minis for this and the has four pages of line drawings showing how the armies look and what colors to use for each of the different armies.
Scale for 28mm is 1 figure = 20 men. You can change this if you like using 15, 6, or even 2mm (for 1:1 fun) change range and movement distance as you scale down.
Orders are written down with simultaneous movement.

23426.name: Valtra Tractors
23426.description:
A tactical game where each player is trying to build the longest route for his/her tractor.

Re-implements:

Bombay Bazar

23428.name: Mission Impossible Game
23428.description: Players start at the four corners of the board and use a spinner to move 1-6 spaces. Players are also able to use Road Block cards and Mission Impossible cards to achieve their objective.

23429.name: Mighty Comics Superheroes Game
23429.description: Includes superheroes from comic books published under the Mighty Comics imprint of MLJ/Archie (who were more successful publishing teenage humor comics featuring Archie and friends). Many of the featured heroes are members of the Mighty Crusaders team. For some reason several of the names are slightly different from how they appear in the comics. The ten heroes featured are: The Shield, The Web, Mr. Justice, Fly Girl, Fly Man (originally called The Fly), Captain Flagg (spelled with one "G" in the comics), The Hood (The Black Hood), Mr. Fox (The Fox), Mr. Jag (The Jaguar), and Mr. Steel (Steel Sterling). First to the middle wins.

23430.name: Justice League of America: The Flash Game
23430.description: Board has playing spaces in the shape of letter "F." Board background features The Flash, Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman and The Martian Manhunter. Comes with insert with built-in spinner and game cards. Spin the spinner and be the first to the finish square.

23431.name: Tarzan Jungle Map and Treasure Hunt
23431.description: Tarzan Jungle Map and Treasure Hunt came free with the purchase of Weston's English Quality Biscuits in 1933. The map measures 20" x 14" and is in full color.
